Reviews.Title: “Great Location Bike Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Cape8101
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our Key West motorcycle trip and enjoyed staying at the Key Lime Inn. We found the room, #5, very clean and the air conditioner worked very well. There was plenty of room for the two of us and there was a private courtyard area off of our room. The bed was very comfortable and plenty of room for the two of us. When booking a room for a motorcycle trip, a big priority for me is parking. Going to Key West parking can always be a problem. While researching I found the Key Lime Inn has their own parking area. I was pleasently surprised when the desk clerk said I could keep my bike by our room, even though our room was at the back of the property. This was very nice to have the bike right out side our room where I could keep a good eye on it. The breakfast is served around the pool with a very nice selection and they also have coffee makers in the room. The Inn is just a couple blocks off of Duval making it a short walk to the main strip in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Not truthful”
Reviews.Author: Rokeno
Reviews.Content: The inn is located in a good location, the room is so so especially for the price but the breakfast is a joke and you are eating outside on old picnic tables. My biggest complaint is the lack of parking spaces. They say they have free parking but apparently not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “was just OK”
Reviews.Author: Wickedqueen64
Reviews.Content: We were put in the historic Maloney house. There was nothing about the room that suggested we were in a historic house. The king sized bed needs to be replaced as the springs squeaked every time you rolled over. The exhast fan in the bathroom didn't pull the condensation from the air and as a result the floor was VERY slick. The maid service was good, and the room seemed clean. The included breakfast was nothing to get excited over. It consisted of cereal, yogurt, english muffins, blueberry muffins, bagels, and toast. No protein available, and no tea was offered, only coffee and OJ. The pool was great and well maintaned. While they offer free onsite parking, there isn't always enough parking for all. It was a good walk to Duval St. and Mallory Sqaure. Loved the Keys and if I am lucky enough to return, I think I would look for something closer to Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Erin T
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, bed was very comfortable and the air worked! We stayed four nights at the end of February. The weather was great but very humid. After being in the room for about 15 minutes the air felt good. Good overall location depending on what you are looking to do. We didn't have a car but took the staffs advice and rented bikes. Perfect choice! The staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “not the best”
Reviews.Author: Christine G
Reviews.Content: Nice room ; the parking is a big issue and very unpleasant ; staff just OK ; breakfast : nothing exceptionnal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and helpful staff but quality of room varies”
Reviews.Author: Jeff m
Reviews.Content: Three night stay in mid February. Room was a little shabby but comfortable. Very humid and ,as others have noted, A/C was not of much help. Staff is helpful and location is very good. Parking is somewhat limited and, in Key West, this is an important consideration. Since not everyone who stay here have cars (plane and boat access to Key West is popular) that is more of a problem in high, winter, season. We have stayed here before during January and in a larger pool side room. That stay was much more comfortable. Very good walking location for sightseeing and restaurants. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good loction...not the best of accomodations”
Reviews.Author: R M
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay. The accommodations were mediocre at best. The room was run down and in need of an update. The room was very humid, the a/c did little to remove the humidity, everything felt damp. Left my wife and I with headaches each morning. The location is good but the place needs work. Don't know how it compares to other places in the area, but would recommend looking around. On a positive note, the staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Was not up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Pluggeral
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several nights in early February.When I booked this I was under the impression this was a 37 room historic hotel.The office is, my room was a small humid cabin with a clogged sink drain. We had one face towel on the first day and one washcloth the second day. Parking is an issue-there does't seem to be enough. The bed wasn't very comfortable. The pool looked nice however I didn't get to use it due to weather conditions. Breakfast was served near the pool area which lacked a variety in different food items for the days we were here.The staff was friendly.It was a pretty long walk to a lot of the major sight seeing attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: BandMang
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Presidents day weekend with my wife. From beginning to end the staff was so very nice. The layout and the cottages/rooms inspired a cozy feeling. The pool was great but who really needs it in Key West. The rooms were modern, the housekeeping on point. This place makes you feel like you're on an island. It had a handsome rooster we named "blue" that loved getting a slice of wheat toast from the continental breakfast they serve every morning. There is a hammock tucked in the back corner with a great view of the stars that was very relaxing for two people. Just a great value play in my opinion. We had room #10, it is in the house that was converted into 8 rooms. Large balcony, small fridge for stuff, safe, beach towels (nice touch), and a ceiling fan which I loved as an option. Just make sure that you take note of the smaller parking lot as it can fill quickly. Just rent a scooter or bike and leave the car parked. We loved this place, and will be back next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: doctorgooz
Reviews.Content: Supposedly the first motel built in Key West, its two long blocks from Duval on Truman - not really near the middle of the action, but kind of walkable to most sites in Old Town. Pretty far from the Mallory Square scene. One supposed advantage is that there is parking on the property, but there are not nearly enough spots for the crowd. We had to park on the street most nights, which kind of defeats the purpose of a motel. Since this was built years ago as a motor lodge, there is really no main building - you check in by the building near the pool, then get assigned an individual cabin, or a room in a small building (we had the latter). Slow check in and no luggage help, so we had to drag a big luggage cart across the wood-chip filled parking lot. Room was decent sized, but we had the deluxe king. Our pals had the deluxe queen, which didn't even have a window. Shower stall only (no tub), small sink, not much room for bathroom materials. One day we were up early, got back to the room at 2 (room was not serviced), then took a nap until two. When asked if we could get service, we were told the cleaners had left for the day. Hard to believe we are the only people in town taking a nap at 2, but we were handed some clean towels and that was that. At $279 a night, I expect a bit more than that. The pool was very nice, and the continental breakfast was ok (fruit, breads, cereal, juice, coffee). If the location was better, I could have dealt with the quirks and provided a higher rating. But I have to think there are better choices in town, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay overall”
Reviews.Author: newanda_75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights at the Key Lime Inn in February, 2012. Overall, we had a very good experience. The location was perfect in that it was walking distance (by our standards) to all major KW attractions. Very quiet -- at least when compared to some other hotels closer to the nightlife -- but it might have helped that we were in an upstairs room. The room itself was quite clean. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and I'm usually really picky about this aspect of my hotel stays. The staff was quite friendly and helpful. On the downside, as other reviewers have noted, this inn is not a luxury resort. But it has some dated charm, in a recently renovated sense. I was a bit disappointed that they didn't have parking available when we arrived in the evening -- we were directed to find street parking until spots opened up in the a.m. The following morning, we got a spot on the property, and it didn't turn out to be a big deal, just a minor annoyance. Also, the breakfast was ... OK. It wasn't much -- bagels, muffins, cereal, coffee, orange juice, and apples -- but it was, well, OK. To sum up, we had a very good stay at the Key Lime Inn and a wonderful stay in Key West. Quite pleased with it overall. I'd certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Redfanjan
Reviews.Content: Liked our room a lot. #11, upstairs in the Maloney Bldg. It was a distance from the pool and the street...so very very quiet. Lots of pillows and a comfortable bed. Very clean. The private porch had no view except the roof of an adjacent cottage. The morning food offerings were just okay. The pool was clean and nice to use midday, for a respite and refreshment before heading out to the town. Easy wnalking access to all parts of the island located near Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not fabulous...”
Reviews.Author: annegirl50
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights and 4 days in Key West. The room was dated but clean. Noisier than I expected, the person in the next cottage either was an inconsiderate clod OR the door was difficult to close. Which is the most likely scenario since my bathroom door has the same issue. But the door slamming was loud and woke us several times. Our cottage was close to the rock driveway so we heard all the vehicles coming and going. For the price, even in expensive Key West, I would expect a little more. The breakfast served by the pool is nice but very minimal. Suited us ok, but some folks expected more. The staff was very helpful and congenial. The place was clean and very quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend getaway...”
Reviews.Author: travelingteacher1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Key Lime Inn for our babymoon last weekend. You cannot beat the location.. it is 2 blocks from Duvall Street (where all the action is). We were in one of the free-standing "cottages," which was cute but pretty tiny. It was clean and had all of the necessities. It did not really have a usable patio. Let me add that staying that close to Duvall comes at a price... you can hear traffic outside periodically. Because of that, the resident rooster (who starts crowing at about 4 am), and the church bells across the street, I went to CVS to buy $2 foam earplugs for the A.M. Worked like a charm! It's not really much of a hassle taking into consideration the price (it is pretty reasonable) and the fab location. We would absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great to be Back!”
Reviews.Author: C-Sprite55
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Key Lime Inn. We so enjoyed our last stay, that we looked forward to returning. We stayed in one of the cozy cottages with a king bed, sitting area and a private deck The staff was friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the free continental breakfast with the resident rooster each morning. He was very considerate not to crow in the middle of the night! Rooms were clean and beds more comfortable than the last time we were here. My only complaint is it would be nice to have curtains on the windows to block out the lights on the property at night. The shades let too much light in. We find the location very central to all the sites in Key West. Easy to walk to them all. After a day of walking it was relaxing to lay by the pool under the palm trees and go for a dip.We look forward to coming back to Key West and the Key Lime Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Good access to Duval St but pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Nikki5886
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in early Feb. The room was clean but very cramped. It was located right next to Hwy 1 so very noisy and the bed was very uncomfortable. Found it to be overpriced for what we got. Breakfast area is much too small.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel with uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Darlingorla049
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on February 7 and were very disappointed. The pool was lovely although mildly warm. The rooms were clean but the beds very uncomfortable - we had friends staying too, rooms 22 and 24 and they could hardly sleep because the mattresses were so lumpy. it's too bad when a hotel management does not listen to the concerns of their guests as the receptionist said a lot of guests had found the beds uncomfortable ...the staff were very friendly and efficiet. Hopefully management will read this review and do something about the beds, the most important feature of a hotel. Also there is rotting wood in the eaves behind the cabins, picture attached which questions the presence of mold in the rooms which are very smelly ...

Reviews.Title: “Marginal at best. Good place to avoid”
Reviews.Author: daniel742
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a collection of very tiny cramped and only marbiannly clean There is also a tiny swimming pool with tables arou d it. Listed as bed and breakfast but breakfast is really minimal an very un attractive. Very uncimfortable beds and pillows bath very cramped

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as described”
Reviews.Author: sarc549
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, small and cozy but very plain. Only one chair in the room, so one of us had to sit on the bed. No pictures on the walls and only blinds on the windows. Curtains would have given it a more at home feeling. The rooms are separate bungalows and located away from the road. It was very quiet at night and was a very convenient walk to Duval street. We walked from the hotel to Mallory square to watch the sunset. Hotel is exactly as described on the website. The front staff was very friendly and helpful. The Housekeeping staff was very pleasant. The decription of the hotel was exactly as stated on the website. Parking was very limited onsite and once you got a spot you didn't dare move your car. There were several places to park across the street in front of the church. Our room had a mini fridge good for keeping water and drinks. The TV was very small but who is there to watch TV? Towels were provided for the pool. The free breakfast was very well attended, with cereal, bagels, english muffins, toast, yogurt, fresh fruit,pastry, orange juice and coffee, best of all it was included!

Reviews.Title: “Moldy and Nice”
Reviews.Author: david p
Reviews.Content: Room 18 If it were not moldy and stinky it would have been very nice. The hotel is part of Historic Inns of Key West. The rooms are not historic. The only building at the Key Lime Inn that is Historic is the main check in area. The location is very good and was perfect for our needs, not on Duval but just 2 short blocks away. Pool area was great but the pool was not heated as advertised and as stated when we arrived. Our 3rd day out our room was not cleaned and no fresh towels supplied. If we were to return to Key West we will try another Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed!”
Reviews.Author: Erin_Chicago
Reviews.Content: I researched moderately priced lodging for our trip to KW, and this property wasnâ€™t too much more expensive than the chain hotels on the outskirts of town. I loved the location--we walked to Duval St, South Beach, Danteâ€™s on the other side of the island. Itâ€™s on a main road, but we didnâ€™t hear much noise from traffic & the individual bungalos were wonderful. Iâ€™m so glad we stayed here. I thought it was a great value for the price. The staff was friendly, the pool was clean & the room was comfy. Lovely grounds and peaceful swing. Unfortunately the poolside bâ€™fast was underwhelming, consisting of store bought bagles, muffins, yogurt, and sometimes frozen cream cheese, although the setting is nice. We were in Cabin 15. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Key West B&B”
Reviews.Author: walkabout1089
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to Key West we selected the Key Lime Inn after a brief online search. The Key Lime Inn is located on Truman Avenue, a few blocks from Duval Street, easy walking distance. The property consists mainly of small cabins, with the office/registration area inside a former house on the property. A generous continental breakfast is included in the price. Our room (cabin #2) was more of a studio arrangement, neat and clean. The bed was comfortable and we had the following amenities: mini-fridge, coffee maker, tv, free wi-fi, in-room safe. The bathroom was tiny, with the shower and toilet occupying the same room and the bathroom sink was in the main studio space. I noticed that the wooden flooring between the bed and closet was uneven, with some ragged edges. Overall, the room was comfortable, not fancy, and was a pretty good value for money, considering the location. The staff were friendly and very helpful in arranging activities and tours we were interested in. The pool area was well-maintained and had plenty of seating around it, with some sunny and some shaded areas. Overall, it was an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Proximity to Duval Street & Hemingway's Home, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: taylorplayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 6 on the first floor of the inn building by the parking lot. Other reviewers have complained of excessive road noise from Truman Street traffic; we didn't find that to be the case. That said, you may findthe the AC unit and room fridge compressor (next to the bed) a bit loud as they kick on and off overnight. This is an older building that has been restored nicely with hardwood floors (no carpet) and just a hint of wear and tear. The property is quaint and the room and linens were very clean and presented well. Not a ton of closet space, but adequate for a couple staying for a weekend. There is continental breakfast served by the pool area. We paid $200 for a Friday night stay (January) and I would recommend this property as it's within walking distance of many attractions and the bar scene and shops but far enough away that you don't have the rowdy crowds raising hell outside your room at 3am. If you found this review helpful and you think your interests are similar to mine, check out my other submissions for more Key West restaurants and hotels. I did a lot of research before our trip and may be able to save you some time...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: clarksvegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in January. Location is great, can walk or bike to all sites, and far enough from Duval to be quiet. The room was clean and quite, but the bed was not very comfortable. The breakfast and pool area were nice, along with the grounds in general. Another plus for us, was there was a fair amount of parking, as we drove in from FLL. Parking can be an issue at some places in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Location- and that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: Lhenry128
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a friend's recommendation- but it had been a few years since they were here. Location is terrific. Hammock was great. Room was spacious - but lacked furniture. One chair - it seemed as if they took out the other chair? Sink in the room- dorm room size bathroom - shower only. Small flat screen TV for the size of room. Housekeeping consisted of making the bed and exchanging towels - nothing else for the four days we were there. I've had better continental breakfast at a Best Western - worst coffee I have ever had. Had to pay up front when we checked in- I guess that eliminates leaving early for other accommodations - which we probably would have done. Will neither recommend or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - But?”
Reviews.Author: booker_idaho
Reviews.Content: We read the previous reviews and were expecting at least a 3 star stay but that must be for the location. The room was about 10 x 11 with a queen bed with the sink in the room. It had a small toilet and shower which was only large enough for one person to use at a time. The furnishings were dated and the bed was hard. It is like a small motel building with small rooms. The patio area is a wood deck and it is well worn. The good things I can say about it, was it was clean and the staff is friendly. As I said before the location is good because it is about 2 blocks from Duval St. which is where everything is located, from restaurants, bars, shops and 'anything' you might want. The one thing that I wish we had done before doing anything in Key West is drive around. On the east side of the island is probably the prettiest beach that I have been on. That is also where the Sheraton is located which looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “We lucked out!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephan S
Reviews.Content: After doing tons of research on places to stay for our honeymoon, we picked The Key Lime Inn. We could not have asked for a better location. Just off the craziness of Duval Street, the Key Lime Inn was perfect in every way. Our private bungalow was amazing. I have nothing negative to say at all - we loved it!! The staff was great...parking was no problem, and our stay at Key Lime just added to the perfect honeymoon we had in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Located and cute”
Reviews.Author: CzSe
Reviews.Content: Like to stay close to the action but still in a peaceful area-this is it. Romantic rooms and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Roundwound52
Reviews.Content: We got to the Inn early (around noon) and our room was not yet ready, which was understandable. The front desk staff were very couteous and offered to hold our bags, offered us use of the pool, pool towels, and showed use where the front desk restroom was in case we needed to change. We decided to go find some lunch instead, but appreciated their efforts to make us at home. We stayed in one of the Malone House rooms. I believe these rooms are the larger rooms at the Inn. We found them only average size, but this is understandable given the nature of most Old Town KW properties. The room was clean, with a mini fridge and small bathroom. Hardwood floors were nice, and the room had a door that opened onto an interior hallway as well as to the front porch of the house, about 20 yards from Truman Ave. We sat outside on the front porch area to have a few drinks in the evening before going out for dinner. The property was nicely landscaped with some palm trees, flowering bushes, and mulch and stone walkways between the buildings. There are a few sitting areas and hammocks in the spaces between the cottages and the main Inn buildings. Nothing too fancy, but it definately contributed to the relaxing atmosphere. The pool was decently sized and clean. The pool has a deck around it, where they serve breakfast. The breakfast was standard continental, yogurt, fruit, cereal, juice, bagels, coffee, tea, etc. The property is centrally located, a 5-10 minute walk from both Duval Street and the Southernmost Beach area. The front desk staff was extremely helpful setting us up with rental bikes (<$15 a day for two bikes), which can be used to get from one side of the island to another in 15 minutes or so. There were racks to lock the bikes to near the front desk area, which I highly recommend doing at night. We flew into EYW so we did not have a car with us, but there is parking at the Inn, which is something of a rarity in the Old Town area of KW. Our stay was for 3 nights. Overall the property was a good value, clean, and had friendly helpful staff. Nothing too fancy, but just right for a short trip to KW.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the prices”
Reviews.Author: MiamiDaveK
Reviews.Content: We booked the Key Lime Inn over Christmas and I have to say there were good and bad elements but overall its certainly not up to the prices paid and the ratings people have given here which I don't get. On positive note the rooms themselves are very nice and the setting is nice and Key Westy, but I think this hotel is living off shine and not substance. Negative facts: Parking is a nightmare. It mentions nothing about first come first serve in the website unyet we were told this is clearly shown. It was difficult to park nearby and when we had trouble parking the staff were not helpful at all, could not advise on anywhere they knew might be OK to park and I was generally not happy about this. We could not park in the main car park the whole time we were there, The toilet was blocked and once again the desk staff needed me to come up with the ideas. I ended up having to take a mucky plunger to my room through the breakfast eating guests to plunge the toliet in my $200+ per night room myself!!! The room floor was never swept the whole 5 days we were there. The bathroom generally smelled, it just needed a bit of bleach or cleaner. The pool was not clean and the generator for the pool swicthed on early in the mornings which made our stay a bit noisy. Breakfast was exactly the same every day, it consisted of cereal, orange juice (not fresh as we saw them filling it up!), weak coffee/tea and toasted bagels, muffins and bread. It could have been just a bit better in my view. lastly, being picky maybe was that we had a room by the pool but were always woken up by people eating breakfast right by our window at 8.30am. One lady I had to ask not to do her morning business Skype call so loudly and the chairs and tables were just noisy. i thought we would have had a proper table and chairs on our own blacony but we didn't. We spoke to ther guests whilst we were there. Some were also very unhappy with the parking and someone else did say that their room was noisy as it was by the road and carpark. We noticed that quite a few rooms are by the road and car park but we immune to noise in a way as we are city dwellers normally. All in all I just think Key Lime Inn could have done a bit more, treated us with a bit more respect and I do think we left having spent a good deal of money without really seeing good value for it.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the beef?”
Reviews.Author: ipushufall
Reviews.Content: I think that the people who rated The Key Lime Inn positively have it confused with some other place. We stayed in room #30. Upon entering, I was under whelmed with the size and amenities of the room; and overwhelmed with the smell of mildew emanating from the damp and visibly dingy carpeting. There was no refrigerator, no microwave, no coffeemaker. The sink was right next to the bed. The lights over the bed did not work. Iâ€™m from South Florida and found the room very humid (probably as a result of the damp carpet). If you want to open a window, forget about it, they removed the knobs so that you canâ€™t. The shower is proportionate to the room, as it is just a stall. Another reviewer mentioned that if you drop the soap, you have to step out of the shower to pick it up, I laughed when I saw that because it is absolutely true. Also, the first night, we asked for an extra blanket and they said no. The bed was pretty, the sheets were clean, but it the mattress was hard. Itâ€™s not all bad though. It was cool having breakfast with a rooster. The breakfast itself was O.K., not the typical B&B breakfast that youâ€˜d expect. It was more like the continental breakfast at Super8. Bagels, pastries, juice, coffee, cereal. It was a good distance from Duval (not too close, not too far). The property and grounds themselves are pretty. I had a good wifi connection from The Chelsea House next door. All and all, I didnâ€™t have a good experience. It wasnâ€™t what I was expecting. Maybe theyâ€™re cutting corners because of the economy. Not worth the price, wonâ€™t stay here again. Wouldnâ€™t recommend to a friend unless I was mad at them. Shop around, the rooms arenâ€™t as pretty as the pictures. Theyâ€™re selling the sizzle, not the steak. If you want the steak stay somewhere else. Not traditional, welcoming, or quaint. Just small, stinky, and kind of blah.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: NancyWrenshall
Reviews.Content: This quaint little inn was a delight. We were not quite sure what to expect after reading some of the reviews when booking a room, but were very pleasantly surprised. The staff were friendly, seemed happy to see us and were very helpful. The cottage was clean, the air was on so it was nice & cool and the bed was very comfortable. It was a great location for walking just about anywhere in Key West. It's a one of the heritage inns so if you're looking for modern - go somewhere else. If you like clean, friendly, comfortable with a great pool for cooling off after a day of walking around - it's a great choice. We'll go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could use some updates”
Reviews.Author: sulla62
Reviews.Content: The cottage we stayed in was overall nice - the king-size bed was very comfortable - but the interior needed some updating. The bathroom was very small. The shower stall especially was just that - just a stall - no shelves for bottles or anything - I had to place my shampoo, razor, etc., on the windowsill outside the shower - and there was little light from the fixture. Same with the sink which was outside the bathroom - no place to put items. But the room overall was comfortable. We were provided beach towels and there was a nice pool. However, being on a main street, the noise from traffic could be a bit loud at times with people shouting and blaring music late at night. Staff was pleasant and made recommendations for dinner. Breakfast was ok - eating outside when it wasn't quite warm and windy wasn't exactly ideal.

Reviews.Title: “The Good & bad about Key Lime Inn”
Reviews.Author: linedancer6
Reviews.Content: The good-rooms are cottages-one floor. No stairs, elevators or noisy hallways to deal with. Staff very friendly. Free parking. Convenient location for driving or walking. Nice continental breakfast. Wood floors in most rooms. No bathtubs. This is good for some people who have a hard time getting in & out of tubs for showers. Very clean. Refrigerator. Nice size bathroom-looks refurbished. I would stay here again. The bad-The rooms are very sparsely furnished. One queen size bed, one night table & lamp, dresser, chair. I would have liked to have one more chair & a nightstand on my side of the bed. No microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: keeo66
Reviews.Content: The property is very charming--rooms tucked all throughout the palm tree covered walkways, hammocks, and a nice pool and deck. We had 2 king rooms--they were roomy and comfortable. The only disappointment was the service--an example being the extreme slowness of the housecleaning and the lack of urgency about it from the front desk. This was a very special trip for my family and the delay of our room being available started us off on a disappointing note. I will choose another property for my next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Key Lime Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Jixny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Key Lime for 3 nights in November and absolutely loved it. We had a king deluxe room #37 by the pool. It was a nice size room and very private because it was in the corner. The inn is in a great location for walking to everything. We also took the trolley tour and used it to get around. We can't wait until we can come back to Key West again and we definitely stay at the Key Lime inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Our 5th Stay - Always Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Marc19002
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay here. We always have a great time. If you are looking for the Hilton or Hyatt, this is not it and the Key Lime Inn will not meet your expectations. We always stay in the same room (#4) which we just love. The room is large enough to feel comfortable. Great A/C and very large shower. Beautiful hardwood floor. Always very clean. However what really makes this place special are the staff. My wife and myself always feel welcome. They remember us from year to year and welcome us back. Wifi - If wireless is essential to you, I would suggest getting a room closer to the pool/lobby as the wifi is spotty is some of the rooms. This inn is about a 15 minute leisurely walk to Margaritaville, 20 minutes to Sloppy Joe's, 25 minutes to Mallory Pier and 25 or so to Higgs Beach. It is about 2 blocks off of Duval, but well above the "party zone" which we like. Can't wait till next year!

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with Key West and with this inn! Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: Nubia B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Key Lime Inn for 3 nights back in May, 2011, and we definitely recommend this place. We had originally planned to stay for 2 nights only, but we loved everything so much that we decided to stick around for another day. We couldn't be happier with our choice of hotel! The staff is so helpful and makes you feel like you're home. Sue at the front desk was a sweetheart and gave us wonderful tips on what to do and where to go while we were there. Our room was lovely - not very big but had everything we needed. The bed was comfortable, and the room and bathroom were incredibly clean. The breakfast was ok - not outstanding as everything else was, but overall very good. The swimming pool was also clean and nice, and we never heard any noises from our room. We loved the Key Lime Inn and we want to go back there some day! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Charming with wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: LowCountryGal_16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Key Lime Inn for 3 nights in early October 2011. While this was not our first trip to Key West (several stops while on a cruise ship), it was the first time we drove down from Savannah. The ride down was a new experience, I really expected more bridges than land! We drove to Fort Lauderdale, spent the night there so that we could continue the drive the next morning and see all the keys by daylight. We reserved a Deluxe King room and were placed in Room 10 which is on the second floor of the Maloney House. There are two doors to this room, one from a corridor and one from the porch. The porch view was toward the street, with a canopy of palm trees to obscure the view some but not totally. We rather enjoyed being on the second floor with this type of view. It was a very clean and spacious room, 12 foot ceilings, with one window looking out to the very large & long front porch and the other two windows were side by side looking out the side of the building which overlooked the cottages. We checked in early, and it was no problem to gain access to our room. Katie was at the front desk and was such a help with attractions, dining, etc. Ask for coupons to area establishments - especially dining. Katie told us that many places were likely closed because we were there during the "off season" - time between Labor Day and Fantasy Fest! We didn't find any limitations on what we hoped to do because it was off season. Some of Katie's best advice was to grab a parking spot on the property and not move without the risk of losing that spot. The Inn was expected to be nearly all full by early evening. We were able to park directly below our room and made unloading easy. I have read some complaints about the mulched pathways making it difficult to roll luggage to your room. We didn't find it a nuissance and thought it added to the charm. How much do you need to pack anyway? It's Key West! Same goes for the roosters! It's Key West! (I can honestly say that I couldn't hear a rooster while trying to sleep for the drone of the AC unit!) We rented bicycles from A&M Scooters just a block & a half away from the Inn. I believe the prices are $15 per 24 hours per bike, with a lower rental rate if you didn't need a full day. We must have received some sort of discount, we had 2 bikes for 32 hours for $32.25 total! Bike riding IS the way to go! The bikes have a basket, lock, key on an elastic wristband, and lights for night-time riding. Bike racks are everywhere. We so enjoyed riding bikes to supper, Mallory Square, shopping, the attractions, and bicycling through sidestreets looking at the architecture. We were able to take advantage of a Key Lime Inn promotion, Stay Longer / Get More. We received complimentary cocktails - served poolside at sister property, Lighthouse Court and got 2 free tickets to the Hemingway House. We loved strolling Duval Street by day and especially at night. It's fun to eat outdoors and watch locals and other tourists stroll by. Trust me, you will see everything -- the drag queens promoting their show are a hoot! Lots of choices for shopping & dining. Key Lime Inn pros: Large, spacious clean room - plenty of windows in Room 10! Safe located in the closet was very useful, as was the room fridge. Helpful staff Picturesque setting Wireless connectivity. Could use improvement: Key Lime Inn bathrooms really need a shelf or or corner table for toiletries. Not a huge deal, but a microwave would have been great to heat up leftover dinner. Trip Highlights: Mangos Restaurant -- large outdoor dining area, fantastic menu, excellent service & atmosphere. Cheeseburger in Paradise -- when you get tired of seafood! Truman's Little White House -- Excellent tour, informative, such a beautiful area of town. Renting Bicycles and riding around -- no need for a car -- really! A slice of Kermit's Key Lime pie! Yum! Driving down US-1 from Miami to Key West - gotta do it once! Next time, we will try the sunset sail. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet, good location”
Reviews.Author: gracieg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during Fantasy Fest 2011. It was close enough to walk to everything. Checkin was a breeze and the people at the desk were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a little sparse and the wifi was only available out by the pool. We never heard any of the noise from roosters or the Fest, but our room was way in the back, away from the road and the pool. The bathroom/shower was small and could definitely use some extra shelves. The shower only had one soap dish so my conditioner, shampoo and razor ended up on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “our first trip to key west”
Reviews.Author: Denny B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Key Lime Inn for 5 nights in October, 2011 for our first trip to Key West. We stayed on the second floor in a king room. The room was fantastic, very clean, and quiet. The staff were awesome - always willing to answer questions from tourists. We rented a car for the week but didn't need it - we walked everywhere we needed to go. We definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Oct 2011 Trip to Key West”
Reviews.Author: Jeff F
Reviews.Content: We were at the Key Lime Inn Oct 13-20th. The location is great, just far enough away from the noise to get a good nights sleep yet close enought to walk to Duval Street where the action is. The housekeeping and servises were very good and the pool was clean and well kept. Cons: The breakfast was put out late every morning and the food was a bit sparse with a very limited selection at best.

Reviews.Title: “A great little Inn”
Reviews.Author: Dee06_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Key Lime Inn for 8 days this October. The location is ideal for walking to most of the sights on the Island. The housekeeping was excellent and the room was comfortable. A continental breakfast was served each morning, but sometimes not until 8:30 (coffee was available much earlier in the main building). Although on a sometimes busy street, our room (Rm #14) was actually very quiet. The grounds are very well maintained as well. There is a bike rental shop a few doors down, a CVS nearby and you are just two blocks from Duval Street. This is a nice place for couples and small groups but would not be good for children. All in all, this Inn met our expectations and we would gladly recommend it to family and friends and stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Our two day stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: rriner
Reviews.Content: One of our main reasons for selecting this inn was the location. However, we were disappointed. What looked like a short walk to Duval Street and the wharf area was actually quite a hike. We are used to walking daily, but one trip to the most "touristy" areas was all we wanted to make. We were afraid to move our car from the parking lot as we were told parking is limited. The staff was nice and helpful. The room was clean , but very small. Not at all what I expected for the price we paid and the brochure implied. The breakfast was nothing more than we had at any budget motel. My top priorities for motels are cleanliness, price and location. This one met only one of those--cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Quiet Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: B0bsiba0k
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best bed and breakfast for the money in Key West. Lovely and quiet in a central location, this hotel is near everything. Walking to the beach or downtown Key West is a breeze. Staff is friendly and accomodating. Rooms are clean. Breakfast is more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Howie G
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Key West and the Key Lime Inn. I could not have asked for a better weekend get away. The accomodations were wonderful and the employees at the Inn were very attentive to our needs. Devon, the front desk person was also great, always had a smile on her face. The room and pool was clean and well taken care of. I'm looking forward to my next visit. Location was within walking distance to Duval St and many other shopping areas and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: lrmcsmom
Reviews.Content: We love this place! It was the second year in a row we stayed for a long weekend at the Key Lime. The rooms are very clean and the staff is awesome! The location is one of the best we have ever experienced in the Keys. Far enough away but close enough to everthing to get there in a short walk. The pool is wonderful in the mornings while you eat the continental breakfast that is provided. I have stayed a lot of places in Key West but I won't stay anywhere else from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: catjay74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Key lime Inn, in sept 2011, we originaly booked for 3 days, but loved the quirkyness and the peace and quiet, so decided to stay for another night. Very small complex, very intimate and not too crowded. Rooms are small, but very clean. Our room was right next to the pool and outdoor breakfast tables, but wasnt interupted by any noise. The staff were amazing and very helpful, treated you like a friend rather than a guest, We have stayed in key west many times before and this was deiffinately the best stay. Great Location for Duval street and Mallory square. The only downside i could find fault with was the air conditioning was a little old and noisy and the pillows could do with replacing, but other than that.excellent time had by all! A tip for booking, call the hotel by phone and ask their rates, we gave Â£122 a night, booking before we left uk, when we booked extra night at the hotel it was $109, so a good saving!.......

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ninna1534
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Key lime Inn for our last night in Key West and they were GREAT! Got there early and they invited to stay at the pool till our room was ready. The room was wonderful, plenty of room and very clean. The staff was so nice everyone very helpful. yes I would stay here again and again. thank you Key lime inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Our Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Deoad72
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a week at the Key Lime Inn with our families while we were getting married in Key West. The rooms were nice and well kept and the staff was very accommodating and friendly. The pool is well maintained and average size for a Key West guest house.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, and walking distance to all of Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Chester13210
Reviews.Content: We're a retired couple and were eager to have a getaway for two without breaking the bank. We're glad to chose the Key Lime Inn for our three-night stay. Sue, Paul, Barbara and Devon (all at the front desk) were very friendly and helpful, including during a couple of phone calls prior to our arrival. We decided to take a standard room and save the money. The room was small but very adequate, and was in what appeared to be an older building. As we settled in for our second night, it rained, and to our surprise we had a leaky ceiling (fortunately not over the bed!) I put a wastebasket under it and called the desk. The staff member immediately asked if we'd like to change rooms. I asked if they could upgrade us to a king room, and they did. It was larger and nicer. If we return, we'll pay the extra few dollars for it. What was especially nice was that we could park the car in their lot and walk everywhere in the Old Town area. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service in a clean, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: linnsandjon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went to Key West for our anniversary trip and stayed at the Key Lime Inn. We arrived very late and the hotel staff went above and beyond to be accommodating and courteous when we got off the road, even offering a map and late night dining options. The staff took extra care to make recommendations of the best beaches, water sports vendors, restaurants, and bars. The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet, despite there being thousands of motorcycles on the island. I was particularly impressed with housekeeping doing such a good job of tidying up each day. The special, relaxing touches like the swing and hammock on the property were very much appreciated. The only downside was that the pool was not as clean as we are used to and the breakfast was a little sparse, but it was filling enough to get you through until an early lunch. All in all, we had a wonderful stay and will recommend it to our friends in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The best place in town”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: Excellent little hotel 2 blocks away from Duval street Rooms were very nice and with style (lime). Very good service from the hotel reception free parking!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a lovely old style Key West inn”
Reviews.Author: Susan01904
Reviews.Content: Very nice place with wonderful patio. The rooms are very nicely decorated and the amenities excellent. I highly recommend this inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SoCal_Breeze
Reviews.Content: Excellent, clean inn with exceptional staff! The only thing that could have been better is the morning breakfast. There was no fruit served (at least toward the end of breakfast when we came). Other than that, it's in a great location (a couple of blocks away from Duval Street) and provides a relaxing, quiet atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SurferGirl46
Reviews.Content: The Key Lime Inn was perfect. We had one of the cottages so it was very private. Nicely furnished, comfortable and just the right size. The cottage and grounds were very clean as was the pool. Once we parked on Thursday morning, we never moved the car until we left on Sunday, very convenient to everything, we walked everywhere, but you do need to enjoy walking. The beach was a bike rental away - getting around on bikes was really easy and worth the $15 for the day, we biked to the beach, and to the north part of the island to go on a jet ski trip. We would definitely stay there again and suggest to others. Staff was very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal and Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: coolnatkat
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, the bed comfortable, and the pool is nice after a hot day. The property is quiet (except for the 4am rooster but that's anywhere on the island). It's a couple blocks from Duval, close enough to walk but far enough that it's quiet and safe. The trolley stops 2-3 blocks away, so if you pay for the trolley, it makes it very convienent. We didn't have a car or bicycle; we used the trolley 1 day, and the rest of the time we walked. (Having a car is useless; although Key Lime has parking you won't be able to park anywhere else). The ladies up front were polite and helpful and one put up with a half hour of quizzing from me about the best way to the Dry Tortugas. Minor Negatives: The breakfast was cereal or bagels. The fruit promised was over-ripe apples. Wifi was very poor in our room, but we were on the edge of the property, room 13. The ac left the room either very cold or warm, the controls weren't precise enough. The safe was so small, it was useless for any electronics.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Key West”
Reviews.Author: Maisnatravel
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Key Lime Inn with my 11 year old daughter. We had a deluxe king room cottage with patio which was spacious and cute. I wanted to stay in a place that reflected the historical and architectural aspects of Key West and the KLI certainly delivers and is the best, IMO, of the five hotels within this group. It has a good sized pool, which was clean and very warm for swimming. The complimentary breakfast, served between 8.30-10.30am, is continental and adequate. We did not experience any problems with parking in the hotel car park. The grounds are nicely landscaped with little touches including a hammock and various seating. The hotel is in a great location, being only a couple of blocks from Duval Street with plenty of restaurants and shops. We didn't hire bikes but despite the heat, walked to most places. Explore the back streets.... there are lovely original conch houses to see off the beaten track. We had meals in a number of restaurants including the Grand Cafe, La Trattoria, Conch Republic Seafood, Alonzo's, Blue Heaven and Mangoes. Our best value for money meal was at Duffy's Seafood and Steakhouse just along from the KLI. A special thanks has to go to the KLI reception staff, and especially Vicki for her help and assistance providing a concierge style service during our stay, with lots of tips and advice on where to go. Thanks Vicki!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay @Key Lime Inn”
Reviews.Author: shagu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our anniversary trip and it was great! we had a room close to the pool, it was perfect! I actually wrote the hotel before our trip requesting a nice room and they really accomodated us. The parking space is limited, but we found a parking spot right in front, our suggestion is if you find a parking space leave the car there and rent scooters, that's what we should have done, but for next time :)... They have a nice size pool, very well taken care, everything was always clean, the breakfast is very limited but it was good for us, if you want to eat a little more you can walk a couple of blocks and they have a dennys in the same street. Our room got cleaned everyday, towels changed everyday too, the bathroom could use a little more decor or maybe cabinets to put your things. Another suggestion is that they need to change the ironing boards, ours was rusty and it was difficult to make it stay. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here, they have a great service and we really got more than what we expected for the money we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Hair was everywhere! It was disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: mollball6
Reviews.Content: The rooms themselves are lovely and so was the pool. However, our room (cabin #2) was covered (and I mean COVERED) in hair. When we arrived at around 3pm we immediately showered and found that there were about 40 hairs (all types..) all over the bathroom (walls, floor, toilet, shower stall, etc.). As we are not the type of people to complain (this is my first online review), we cleaned up the hairs and decided that if we didn't find any on the bed, there was no need to contact the front desk. Upon checking the bed, my boyfriend and I decided to request a different room. Not only did we easily find several hairs on the bed (on the pillows and comforter), but on our way out we saw a few on the lampshades! The woman at the front desk was very nice about the situation and switched us over to the only other available room (#10), which happened to be much bigger. Once we'd moved all of our things, just to be sure, my boyfriend and I half-jokingly checked the bed and lampshades for hairs - and they were EVERYWHERE! All over the bed, all over the lampshades and window sills, a few in the bathroom, and, I kid you not, one in the fridge (along with some blue gum). We laughed that if we complained to the front desk again, they'd suspect us of planting them! Of course by then we were looking for hairs, but they really weren't difficult to find. We aren't clean freaks - it was just GROSS. We had to go back to the front desk to return our key to cabin #2 and when they asked how we found our new room, we told them, embarrassed, that it too was rather.. hairy. The woman there assured us that they'd never received such complaints before (which I can't imagine) and promised that the housekeeper would come up shortly to change the sheets. But the housekeeper never came. Many hours later, shortly before we wanted to go to bed, we asked the lady at the front desk to please send up the housekeeper soon. What we got was a pile of fresh linens on our bed, which would have been fine if there wasn't a fair amount of hair imbedded in its fibers! There were also several stains on the sheets. We ultimately ended up picking out the hairs, one by one, before making the bed and going to sleep. Obsessive? Maybe. But by then we were seriously wigged out (pun intended.. ha). As we were picking out the hairs we at first just let them fall to the floor but then we decided to collect a few in a cup so we could post a picture with our review. We also took pictures of the stains on the sheets. Proof!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: blueneonrain
Reviews.Content: Arrived well before check-in time and were allowed to park car in their lot while we started to see sights. Parking is a big deal in Key West! Very pleasant ladies in the office with answers to questions. Enjoyed complimentary breakfast foods around the pool area--love that bagel toasting machine. There was also muffins, yogurt, cereal, orange juice, coffee--basic, but plenty of a breakfast for me. Dining is EXPENSIVE in the Keys--enjoy the included breakfast! Pool was nice, with spa towels in room. We stayed in a stand alone cottage that was clean and had an outdoor sitting area. There are MANY places to choose from for lodging in Key West. We enjoyed the Key Lime Inn very much.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: metschik111
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved everything about this hotel. Cute, clean, quiet, but within walking distance of all the craziness and sights of Duval. I'll be back to Key West and I will definitely stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed!”
Reviews.Author: ewi777
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in Key Lime Inn 2 days, really enjoyed this place - silent, clean, great stuff, perfect location (also supermarket is one block away - if you need some water for example), and free parking! Receptionists were always helpfull, gave us super tip about places to eat and to go..

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: NEWJERSEYSCOTTIEG
Reviews.Content: this is a great little hotel with a nice size pool and great staff it is about three blocks from daval st (if tou go stop by the white tarppon on front st for a keylime martini they are amazing)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & darling place!”
Reviews.Author: MissingParadise
Reviews.Content: The Key Lime Inn is what Key West is all about. We stayed in the Deluxe King room which was really nice. The room was large, with a sitting area, king bed and hardwood floors. It was it's own little "cabin". The bathroom was probably a 2 rating - it was dated, and not very exciting, but the worst part about it that there was no AC in it and it got HOT!!! The bed was comfy, but the pillows were awful. Breakfast was sub-par. They could use fresh fruit, besides apples that sit next to the toaster and become wilted and hot. Hard boiled eggs would be a nice addition too. The location is GREAT!!! The front desk is friendly and helpful. Fun to take drinks out to the pool and meet other guests. The pool was HOT at the end of June when we were there because of the sun that beats down on it, but this is no fault of the hotel. Our friends stayed at the Truman Hotel down the road - very trendy and cute, but I prefered the KLI more. It just felt like what Key West is all about. I don't forsee returning to Key West, too many places to see, but if I did, I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “we love it!!”
Reviews.Author: Gigi12Miami
Reviews.Content: Good price for the Key West area, extremely friendly staff, the room was clean with nice decorations. The hotel is close to everything just a fews block from Duval Street we love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect B&B”
Reviews.Author: Bacterium
Reviews.Content: Great vacation packages & recommended for couples. Directly booking the 'Stay Longer, Get More' package with the Historic Inn was very affordable & lower priced than the discount websites. Included museum admission passes plus coupons for free key lime pie, & cocktails definitely helped us to explore key west & save money. Good sized, clean room with private bath & fresh continental breakfast. Super friendly & attentive staff helped with reservations & quality recommendations. Only negative critique, the pool closes a bit early in my opinion, but overall we loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Slickmyster2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. The room was clean with nice decorations. This place is close to everything, just a couple of blocks away from duval street. They give the standard breakfast which wasnt bad. Next time I'm in town I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: mrscab
Reviews.Content: Thanks Key Lime Inn Bed & Breakfast. Your front desk staff was so helpful in suggesting which tours to take with kids and where to go for a special night out for two. The breakfast was way more than we expected and did I mention the housecleaning staff....really sweet and helpful. We definitely will be back and have already suggested your Inn to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “room pictures not accurate”
Reviews.Author: jsorganizers
Reviews.Content: While it's a nice enough place certain things were an issue. There is only one small high hung mirror in the bathroom... they could invest in a $10 walmart mirror and mount it on a wall so you can at least see how you are dressed. The carpet in our room was full of stains to point that I made sure that I wore my shoes at all times. They were pretty flimsy on towels as well. I had to take a couple of showers in a day (super hot and humid in July) and had to use my wet towels because there weren't enough. Most places give you at least two bath towels per person. We were not told there carts to carry our bags to our room and ended up dragging the suitcases through their mulch covered paths. Not easy! especially during the midday heat. Didn't really see staff or talk to any of them. the upshot... it's close to everything and the sheets were clean. Although the air conditioner sounded like a tractor and is right beside the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Key Lime Inn”
Reviews.Author: DianeC68
Reviews.Content: We felt very at home here. Personnel were very helpful in suggesting ideas of places to see and restaurants to try. Loved the pale green motif and small bungalows. Also loved relaxing under the canopy of umbrellas by the pool. Liked that the rooms were in small bungalows arranged on the property. Room and shower were small, but imagine space is at a premium here. Felt that it was very clean. We rented bikes and were close to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: DogMomsOpinions
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were overall pleased with everything. The room stayed very cool which was a refreshing after being in the heat all day and night. We were upgraded upon our arrival (such a great surprise) to a king room. As mentioned in other reviews, there is no space for toiletries in the bathroom but we made do. The breakfast had the basics, we ate one of our three mornings. I would stay at the Key Lime Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Patch007London
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel purely on previous reviews and, for the location, it was perfect. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a room with a back patio which was lovely to sit out at night. The bed was extremely comfortable but unfortunately I got to sleep the side where the air conditioning unit was located and I did have to switch it off! It certainly wasn't as noisy as some units we have come across but it was close enough to my ear that it made sleep difficult. However, the rooms have good fans which helped. Would I consider it 5* - no, I must be honest and say not. The room itself was actually quite small, mainly taken up by the huge bed. One of the really annoying things I found was the bathroom - in our bathroom there was absolutely nowhere to put toiletries etc. Everything had to go on the floor. Not much thought gone into that one!! Also, the other really silly thing was that the patio had a small raised, bricked area just large enough for the round table and two chairs. If you moved your chair slightly, you fell off the "raised" area. Nit-picking I know but all it needed was a little more thought. Yes, there is a rooster at the back and it woke me up at 7 am as it was actually in our patio. But I guess he had more squatters rights than we did. Breakfast was round the pool - cereal, yogurts, bagels, muffins. One silly oversight was that there was only coffee available - if you wanted hot water for tea you had to walk round into Reception and get it there. Again, just a little more thought. The pool area was nice and clean and although the pool faces the street, you really aren't aware of the traffic due to all the trees around. If you turn right outside the property, a short walk will take you to the junction with Duval Street which is really what Key West is all about. The staff were helpful and our room was clean, with fresh towels every day. Would I stay there again? I'm not sure - I do think it is over-priced and would look at other options. But it does have a different "feel" than other hotels - quite rustic in a way which is a nice change from more structured hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very unexpected pleasure”
Reviews.Author: m3and1
Reviews.Content: You can never be certain as to reviews you read, but we found exclusively excellent reviews for the Key Lime Inn, and were not disappointed in the least. Our daughters stayed in one of the free-standing cabins, and we stayed in a king suite on the second floor in the original mansion house, with balcony looking out over the courtyard area. They were most pleased, as were we with our accomodations and location. Rooms well appointed, extremely clean, beds very comfortable. No complaints. All staff were very courteous and helpful. Although there was the occasional "wake-up call" from the local rooster/cockrel !! Will recommend Key Lime to all of our friends, and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped and more”
Reviews.Author: Talheure
Reviews.Content: We're already talking about when we can go back. The inn's staff was welcoming and helpful, suggesting things to do and restaurants to try (and giving us coupons for some), and best of all, recommending the Java Cat eco-tour, which was wonderful. We stayed in room 12, on the upper floor of the original boarding house. Our room was large and comfortable, with everything we needed, including a wine chiller fridge. It was simple and cool and comfortable, which was frankly a relief after the over-the-top and nearly stifling "luxury" of the everybody's-wearing-matching-fedoras South Beach hotel we came from the night before. The room opened onto a wrap-around gallery that we shared with only one other room. Since that room's guests weren't the porch-sitting types, we had it to ourselves, adding to our sense that we had the house to ourselves. We never heard any noise from other guests or from the street (except the roosters!). Breakfast was cereal, bagels, juice, coffee, fruit, served by the pool, which looked great (but which we didn't use).

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel in the Historic District”
Reviews.Author: marcovacation6
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Inn on Friday afternoon and left Sunday morning. The hotel staff was very friendly. We booked the King Deluxe Suite (#10) and it was very nice. The room was adequate size and the bathroom was large. We had our own balcony with a view of Truman Street. Short walk to Duval and very quiet for a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean....”
Reviews.Author: LeahB444
Reviews.Content: I would give this 3 1/2 stars if I could, I am used to staying in more of a chain type four-five star hotel and therefore my reason for not a higher rating. This is an inn with cute little cabins that look newly painted and were clean. Pros: good location not far off of Duval street, clean, nice patio/pool area, friendly staff (gave us some coupons to use in town) good price for Key West and free parking. Cons: uncomfortable bed, loud, loud ac unit (others complained about roosters waking them up I don't think I could have heard them over the AC!). Overall a decent place with charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Beezer23
Reviews.Content: One of the coolest hotels I've stayed at. Very tropical. Really doesn't feel like you are staying at a hotel, but more like staying in luxurious cabins.. Not sure why there is even one bad review. Pool is the perfect size and temperature. Great place to sit and enjoy a nice cold beer before heading out in the town. If you want a super fancy hotel, then stay at the Westin. Some people reviewing this place must just be angry with life. You're in Key West. Relax!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: hollyinhawaii
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Key Lime Inn for anyone taking in Key West. The rooms are spotless and comfy, and the staff, while not overfriendly, were polite and efficient. I went with a friend, and we decided not to rent a car. Key Lime is close enough to everything to walk, without being right in the middle of all the madness of Duvall Street. The Inn is on Truman, a couple of blocks from Duvall, and although it fronts a busy street, it was surprisingly quiet and peaceful. There's a nice Continental breakfast served by the pool each morning...not too early, and doesn't get taken down until 10 or 10:30 for all of us who wanted to sleep in on our vacations. Although the web site does say it caters to couples, we got a room with two double beds, so they do have them. The pool was clean and nice, the landscaping very tropical, and all in all, it was a great place to stay. I can also recommend a great seafood place just around the corner from them: Seven Fish. It looks like a diner/joint, but is instead a white-tablecloth place without the white tablecloths. Pricey, (but what in Key West isn't?), but you actually get great food there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Sparkling Clean, Quiet, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: ChristianTeam1
Reviews.Content: We just wanted to get away for a few day and enjoy the sights of Key West without too much of the hussle and bussling active nightlife. We found it at the Key Lime Inn. The Staff was very friendly and warm, the grounds were well kept, rooms were immaculate. A quiet and peaceful place to relax. We took a scooter ride and spent most of the time relaxing on our porch and by the pool then took a short stroll to Duval St for Dinner. We will definately keep it on our list for the next time we visit Key West!

Reviews.Title: “BY FAR THE WORST PLACE YOU CAN BOOK YOUR STAY AT”
Reviews.Author: katrina104
Reviews.Content: The rooms are horrible the staff is incredibly unproffesional. the pool is small, the breakfast shouldnt be called a breakfast. i have traveled all over the world and never received such bad customer service. THE PEOPLE WHO WORK THERE ARE INCREDIBLY RUDE AND HAVE NO MANNERS WHATSOEVER. I CANNOT BELIVE THIS HOTEL IS STILL OPEN AND THE PEOPLE THAT WORK THERE ACTUALLY HAVE A JOB. The rugs were filthy the rooms smelled like moist. The showered were probably the smallest showers in the world, if you drop the soap you pretty much have to step out in order the bend down and get it. Its old and run down. I cant say one good thing about this place. I hope someone closes this place down asap i wouldnt want anyone to go through what we went through it really ruined our weekend. They even made us switch rooms after we booked because what we booked on the computer wasnt even available. I would never recommend such a horrible place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: communicate
Reviews.Content: Based on TA we stayed at the Key Lime Inn - We were not disappointed - Great location - park your car for free and walk - clean and quiet (otehr than Mr. Rooster) but you get use to it and look forward to it. We had room #9 and I would request that again - All the girls at the front desk could not have been more helpful - many thx to Sue, Barbara, Denise and Vicki - suggestions for good eats were right on - We especially enjoyed the continental breakfast in the morning - it gave us a chance to meet our neighbors and was just a nice way to begin the day. Staying here you are about 2 blocks for Duval and in a nice area if you don't want loud and crazy. Thank you Key Lime for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stay less than or equal to three days!”
Reviews.Author: cdewys
Reviews.Content: What you need to know: (1) Rooms - I got the upgraded Queen room (#19) and it was uber-clean, roomy, and everything you'd expect for a mid-ranged price of room (roughly $200/night); (2) Staff - Every encounter with the staff was fantastic as they are helpful and friendly; (3) Grounds - The smallish property looks as if it has been renovated within the past couple years and everything is accessible to the main office and pool...the drawback has been mentioned in previous reviews (essentially no pavement between bungalows makes it hard to transport luggage); (4) Amenities - The pool is smallish but well maintained, the breakfast area is nice (by the pool) and efficient, but that is really about it...I wouldn't imagine spending too much time around the pool but it would do for an hour or so; (5) Location - It is situated in the bottom third of the island away from the tourist craziness near the docks, very close to the cemetery, only two short blocks walk west to Duval street, and only about a 10 minute walk to the Southernmost Hotel Group's properties. Bottom line...I will stay at Key Lime again in a heartbeat provided that my stay is less than three full days. If three or more I may want to look at a bigger hotel with more pool amenities, e.g., bar and larger area.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Ssonya
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, small but charming backyard porch. good location. highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “someone needs to shoot the cockrel”
Reviews.Author: Annandale71
Reviews.Content: The inn itself is great, just hope that you get a room far away from the cockrel. He started crowing at 4am and didnt finish till i got up for breakfast. No sleep there then.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rosie2_11
Reviews.Content: Key Lime Inn was the perfect place to stay in Key West--terrific location, great staff, and wonderful breakfast by the side of the pool. The room was not luxurious but comfortable which was just fine with us

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic Trip”
Reviews.Author: Amybiss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I as well as 6 of our closest friends decided to spend our 5th wedding anniversary in Key West. The Key Lime Inn came highly recommended and it met all of our expectations. The rooms are very clean, the staff was Extremely Friendly and helpful which made our stay in Key West that much more enjoyable. Hanging by the pool in the afternoon was very relaxing. I would recommend the Key Lime Inn if you are looking for a quiet, relaxed atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: jkelly517
Reviews.Content: This is the first I have ever posted a review for lodging. We had a great experience in Key West and the Key Lime Inn significantly contributed to this experience. The staff was helpful and friendly, the lodging was quite and welcoming as well as clean and as described. I would come back here without hestitation.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem 2 blocks off Duvall”
Reviews.Author: casmyth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bungalow 20 and loved every minute of it. We were part of a larger group and had a total of 4 rooms at the Inn. The rooms were clean and well appointed. It was quiet (but for an occassional rooster) and charming, yet close enough to all Key West has to offer. The pool area was just the right size and the deck are perfect for a relaxing "happy hour" with friends. I can't wait to go back and preferred this Inn to pricer resorts on the island, where I have stayed in the past for three times the cost... quality and value are to be found at the Key Lime Inn.

Reviews.Title: “I definitely come back to the Key Lime Inn”
Reviews.Author: BROOKLYNLIZZIE
Reviews.Content: I really loved my stay at the Key Lime Inn... the location can't be beat and the staff was very helpful. I had room 31 by the pool It was small but very comfortable. You'll hear the Rooster crowing in the morning, but that made it even more magical. (you can't escape that anywhere on the island) Its a very short walk to Duval Street and around the corner is a great restaurant called 7 fishes.... So you never have to drive anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Key Lime Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: TheRumDaddy
Reviews.Content: I travel to KW often for both business and vacation. Marlon Garnett of Historic KW Properties does a great job of staff training, and it shows at the Ky Lime Inn. It's far away enough from Duval St. to be quiet, but the party is only a short walk away. And no, I didn't get paid or reimbursed to review the place. Paul Artrip

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mccalavano
Reviews.Content: We arrived recently at The Key Lime Inn on Monday April 11. Very small issue with the room was resolved quickly! Thank-you Key Lime. Room we received was very clean and spacious. Very quiet! We stayed in deluxe king room. It was to the right of the Main Guest lodge and was on 2nd floor. Extremely quiet. Would recommend again without a doubt. If you are going to get bikes get from Moped medic. Only 8$ per day per bike. Same bikes as everywhere else. Just much cheaper. 2 blocks from Key Lime! Definately rent bikes. Great way to get around island.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint but clean”
Reviews.Author: mealymike
Reviews.Content: Nice quaint place, good location, friendly staff. Would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at this hotel - not dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: gostling
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 years ago on our last visit to Key West. We liked it so much that we never considered going anywhare else for our stay this time. This time we stayed here for four nights. We chose a superior room for this stay. The room was perfect. Good size although only one king size bed, spotlessly clean, well furnished with easy to control and quiet air conditioning (the weather was very hot and humid for our stay so we appreciated that) The continental breakfast served by the pool each morning was simple but adequate to get the day started. The location is a short walk away from the quieter end of Duval Street so the only noise issue is the chickens that like to crow in the morning - not that they ever disturbed me.

Reviews.Title: “I would come here again”
Reviews.Author: Fender10
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd visit to Key West for my wife and I, and by far, the best accomodations. We had unit #11 on the second floor of the guest house..It was clean, comfortable and updated. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Vikki and Barbara who I mostly dealt with. It is situated in a good location. We thought being right on US 1 (Truman Ave), might have presented a noise problem, but it was kept to a minimum. Only heard the chickens when the porch door was opened. The pool area was very nice. The only fault I could find was that the wooden floor boards around the pool and on the porch to our room could use a little attention. a minor detail. I would highly recommend the Key Lime Inn, and we would certainly stay there again......John and Diana

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean, good service”
Reviews.Author: DanielleNotts
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed it here, especially the cute cabins and lovely pool area and decking. Parking on site, good location, close walk to duval St but away from the rowdiness. Really happy with this booking and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Help to be perfect”
Reviews.Author: JJ06Miami
Reviews.Content: Key Lime inn needs to put shades on the windows! i stayed in unit 13 and it had a huuuuge bay window with no shades! who goes to vacation to wake up at 7am with the sunrise?! They also need to upgrade the mattresses, they were extremely uncomfortable! ive stayed at many hotels in keywest and for the price you pay at key lime inn you deserve a good nights rest which i didnt between the shade-less windows and horrible mattress! The landscaping is nice atleast... I ALSO FOUND A PAIR OF MENS UNDERWEAR ON TOP OF THE WINDOW!!!!!!! There is a little space on top of the closet under a window andi saw them when i was trying to hang sheets to block the sun from coming in the second day! DISGUSTING!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very clean, helpful staff - highly recommend Key Lime Inn”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegirl038
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Key West. We feel very fortunate to have found the Key Lime Inn; it's a quiet, restful place where you can catch your breath after the sightseeing early in the day. The rooms are clean and up to date. The staff is very helpful, offering suggestions for making the most of Key West calling for reservations in the many fine restaurants in the area; all within walking distance from the Inn. We especially enjoyed sitting by the pool in the afternoon, where we could relax and read, away from the action on Duval Street. We also appreciated having a healthy breakfast just outside our room every morning. There is a good selection of cereals, yogurt and juices, muffins, toast, etc. We plan to go back next year with friends. Thumbs Up on this place!

Reviews.Title: “40th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: louis55
