Reviews.Content: the stay was everything we hoped for.the inn, room,and area all were great.we met alot of people not only at the inn but in town and at the bars and resturants. we had an extra good time at Alonzos who has a real happy hour between 4 and 6:30 not only drink but food too.sunset celebration at the waterfront should not be missed what a entertaining time and free. we will be back again not only to key west but also to key lime inn thank you for a memorable time. LOU AND PATRICIA

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip!”
Reviews.Author: deexray
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Key West and my husband took me for my 40th birthday. We had a great time. We arrived before the 3 o'clock check-in and our room was ready. The staff was very helpful with all our questions. They offered make any reservations we needed. My husband had already arranged for bicycles to be delivered. The front desk called while we were checking in to confirm when they would be delivered. The parking is free, which is unusual for Key West. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable, however, one drawback we were unaware of, Key West has many chickens and we had a rooster that woke us up several times during the night. The room did have ear-plugs in the bedside table. All in all, it was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet, quaint setting well-located near, but not too close, to all the activities.”
Reviews.Author: Momer1952
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful and professional. The rooms were clean and comfortable...the hospitality staff did a great job keeping us supplied with clean towels and fresh linens. The pool area was just perfect for reading and relaxing during the heat of the day. We thought the continental breakfast was lacking in variety. It was adequate, but very repetitive and we were surprised that the only fruit offered each morning were apples.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but....”
Reviews.Author: Libby031149
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, the room we had (#22) was VERY damp and moldy smelling; the cold, clammy sheets were very unpleasant. There was no weatherstripping around the door (you could see light on all 4 sides) which let in lots of noise (like the infamous rooster). It was cute, and the pool area/breakfast was OK, but for all that money I would rather have stayed in a modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: kimmeeta
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel. We had cottage #1 right on the road. We were not bothered by road noise. Room was very clean and looked recently updated. My mom's room was #31 and was clean but looked a little tired. I do realize prices are higher in Key West. Maybe if we would have made time to use the pool it would have made it a little more worth the price(our own fault for not using it). No problems with check in. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little oasis of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Hana25
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent three nights at the Inn in one of their little "bungalows". The room was well decorated, comfortable, and very clean. I especially enjoyed the heated pool after a day of wall-to-wall people, noise, heat, and endless attractions of Key West. Most guests ate their buffet-style continental breakfast by the pool. We took ours to the private patio and relaxed over the coffee. Well done, Key Lime Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Key Lime Inn”
Reviews.Author: msrosenstock
Reviews.Content: Convenient, very friendly staff but a small room for the price. Easy walk to all sites but rcommend a bike or scooter.

Reviews.Title: “Host Terry was very welcoming and a great help in planning our days”
Reviews.Author: kselevan
Reviews.Content: Good location to walk to everything. we just parked the car the entire stay. It was quiet during our stay despite being near the road. Clean, comfortable room. Hostess very helpful with recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: advisor015
Reviews.Content: Price increased by $60 dollars per night since 2009. I'd like to come back but will probably look for a better value next time. There is a lot of traffic noise here... a busy street.

Reviews.Title: “The Key Lime Inn was very charming!”
Reviews.Author: MCH12
Reviews.Content: This Inn met my expectations. It was in a great location for walking everywhere, and the grounds were charming and welcoming. It is located near the "quiet" end of Duval Street, which we appreciated for a nice quiet night. The front desk crew was extremely helpful. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. I would select this or one of their other properties again on my next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Key West Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: 40YearsMarried
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Key Lime Inn. The hotel was wonderfully clean and the staff really helpful and friendly. The location was perfect for us, a short walk to everything! Breakfast was simple but always good! Eating by the pool was so much fun with ice storms at home that week. We would love to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Key Lime Inn just feels like Key West”
Reviews.Author: Sveentus
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in K.W. and I flew down with my girlfriend for a last minute weekend getaway. We were on the budget for an inexpensive weekend away and looking for a hotel close to the center of action on the island, yet far enough away to be quiet & relaxing and to provide us with that Key West feel and also be within a reasonable price range. This hotel was perfect fit for all that and more. The location is just a short couple blocks away from Duval Street (where all the action is). The look & feel of this hotel is just how I imagined Key West to be. We stayed in the main 2 story building but loved the small individual cottages on the property, next time we are in K.W. I would definitely stay in this hotel and request one of the cottages as they look so cool. Room was clean and simple with nice dark hardwood floors and nice bed & furniture. No weird or musty smells. Our room was on the 1st floor so we had a secluded porch with some chairs shielded by the tall bushes in the front. Breakfast was served under a canopy out by the pool. Just some fruits, bagels, muffins, juice & coffee, nothing fancy but it was enough. I loved the property of the hotel, lots of greenery & shade from trees, nice woodchip walkways, and hammocks to lounge in. Didnâ€™t swim in the pool as itâ€™s not heated and the water was too cold in November. Wish the hotel had an outdoor hot tub for the â€œcolderâ€� months of the year. The only quirk was that the hotel management is very â€œpickyâ€� about people parking centered exactly on the parking block. They repeated it to us several times even though we were parked properly. It could be because they have a small parking lot and canâ€™t waste any space. Over all I will say if I am ever in Key West again, I will definitely come back and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “we love it here. we've stayed there for 3 ys now & plan to go again nxt year. we love the location !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mjh1823
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. within walking distance of Duval street & so accessable. no elevators to deal with. everything is so convienate .

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Inn, very nice room, fine breakfast buffet, good location”
Reviews.Author: farfartheman
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful experience at Key Lime Inn. The room was very nice, the breakfast buffet offered good food on the patio next to the swimming pool. The staff were friendly and helpful. The Inn is located in the center of the old city within about 8-9 blocks walk to many shops and restaurants on Duval Street and a longer walk still to Mallory Park to view the sunset and the wharf with many seafood restaurants. We would recommend Key Lime Inn to friends and we would stay at the Inn again. Only thing we would change - we want softer pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: Shoji
Reviews.Content: I had a few recommendations but found this on my own. The environment was great, a little oasis with individual cottages and a couple of buildings with multiple rooms. I picked a second floor with high ceiling and a little porch. It was very quiet even though it seemed like a busy street The front office folks were helpful. It was lovely having breakfast by the pool. The logistics of the food setup could be improved and the selections. We are a vegetarian couple and one of us is gluten intolerant. It's hard to accommodate everyone. Maybe add some other fruit besides apples and think about adding protein. I found all the places I checked out pretty pricey, this one included.

Reviews.Title: “Key Lime Inn a treasure”
Reviews.Author: skwalker
Reviews.Content: The Key Lime Inn in Key West Florida was a wonderful, and reasonable priced, place to stay. The grounds are beautiful and the pool area so cozy that it was hard to tear ourselves away to tour the Hemingway House just down the street and the Truman White House just a short bike ride away. Everything from beaches to Duval Street to main attractions is just short walk or bike ride away. The room was lovely and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: michaelraymoss
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times and have had a great experience every time. I always get the Queen Superior room with the fridge. Quiet area except for the chickens crowing on occasion, but that is anywhere in Key West. Close to Duval Street, but not too close. It has a great pool area with a nice breakfast outside in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what Key West is supposed to be”
Reviews.Author: mikerincon
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I absolutely loved this hotel. The ambiance of this hotel is exactly Key West. Small, cozy, and quiet with an old Key West feel. The location is just far enough off the strip to be quiet but literally walk two blocks and you are on Duval and all the action. Parking is phenomenal. If the hotel parking lot is full then park on the side road which has plenty of available space. Very romantic. The rooms are small but i think thats what makes it so intimate. After all it is Key West and if you want a hotel to be grand then stay in Islamorada.

Reviews.Title: “I got no sleep here!”
Reviews.Author: Kades
Reviews.Content: This was my second time here and unfortunately it was not as great as my first stay. It was also way more expensive this year than last year at the same exact time.. I called a couple of days before I checked in because the internet ONLY works next to the rooms closest to the front desk. I had very important work that needed to be done while on my vacation. - Side note - How do you run a hotel and not have internet for all your guest? you know this is a problem... FIX IT !!! The lady at the front desk was kind of rude when I was checking in. (I think her name was Annett. She was swedish or some thing to that effect. ) When I previously called I was told they were going to give me room 33. I was very happy because this room is near the front desk. Well Annett told me that I was in room 22. ( FAR away from the front desk) I told her my situation and in a not so nice manner she replied "i'll see what i can do..." She huffed and Puffed... and looked and sounded so annoyed that i was unhappy with the room that she wanted to give me. Not my problem lady.. fix your internet or communicate with the people you work with.... the next morning some one was having a 30 min conversation outside of my window at 5 in the morning!!! seriously... people are trying to sleep!!! Then again at 7 am people were rolling their luggage and because the floor is made of wood planks it was so loud and woke me up again..... CLUNK CLUNK CLUNK CLUNK CLUNK......... Last but not least... the outside floor is wood chips... it's so hard to drag your suite case across this crap... sure it looks cute but not really working for me when load and unload my stuff. Just like the parking lot all the tinny rocks... hard to load and unload my stuff!!! They do have wheelbarrow type things to help but its just a hassle..

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming”
Reviews.Author: Travelista5
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to take a couple extra days and drive out to Key West after having our flights cancelled due to the snowstorm we heard about on the news. We arrived late and after driving around decided to check into this cute cozy looking place. We found the price was still rather high, paying 156 but much less than some of the other featured hotels and B&B's in the area. There was also no wifi internet here. We had a great room by the pool, room number 34. Only complaints would be the shower and the bottom sheet on the bed. The bottom sheet wasn't very fitted and the shower had no shelves to set our products on, except a soap dish. Also, the floors easily got wet since there was no tub. Breakfast by the pool was a great atmosphere and we spent our morning here before checking out. Pool was immaculately clean and breakfast consisted of bagels, muffins, yogurt, cereal ... just the basics but none-the-less included in the cost of the room. We wish we were able to stay longer but enjoyed what we had experienced. Loved the cozy, isolated feel considering it was steps away from shops and restaurants. Will definitely stay here when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room and Locatio”
Reviews.Author: vegangolfpro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for five days. The location was great; close enough to all of the main attractions to walk, but not so close that it was loud with a lot of traffic. As a lot of other reviewers state, the room was a bit damp feeling, but when you are on an island in the middle of the ocean, I expect pretty high humidity. The breakfast was nice every morning, and the pool was a perfect temperature. We had a deluxe king room, and it was very cozy. My only complaint was the pillows and the lack of a fitted sheet on the bed. The bed itself was nice, but the pillows were too firm and thick for our liking, and the bottom sheet wasn't fitted, so it moved around when we slept. Next time we would bring our own pillows, but we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed My Stay at the Key Lime Inn”
Reviews.Author: salex19
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my husband while he sailed in the Key West Race Week regatta. I really enjoyed it and would stay again. Pros: Customer Service: Denice was fantastic and helped book me a spot on the race week viewing boat. Location: Close to everything in Old Town. I recommend renting a bike from A&N just a few blocks down. You can get to everything. Pool: The pool was perfect and immaculately kept. I spent every morning by the pool and loved it. Breakfast: Yes, it isn't five star- but it is included and presented very nicely. I loved the atmosphere of eating by the pool. Charm and History: I loved reading about the history of the hotel. Very charming and unique! The room was nicely decorated. Cons: Small Room: Our room was small, but only the bathroom was an issue for us-it had not been updated like the rest of the room. Humid Room: I agree with the other reviewers about the humidity of the rooms. We couldn't get anything to dry out- but hey, it's Florida. Internet: They advertise free wi-fi, but I could barely get it to connect, and when it did the service was slow and dropped. I had to give up my plans to skype with my sister and nephew every day. That was frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pelicans6
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The grounds and rooms are well-kept. Breakfast poolside each morning is a wonderful start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great, check around”
Reviews.Author: miamimango
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend at the key lime inn. We chose it because we had relatives staying next door at the mermaid and alligator which was booked and most room significantly more $'s. We booked the nicest room they had, king deluxe @ $218. Room was large and very clean. Overall this is a good location, but Truman is a very busy street. Staff friendly. The parking lost was full and we did have to find a spot on the street, but that is not difficult to do with a big church right across from the inn. Our location by the pool was not very private and I had to keep all the shades and shutters closed or I felt like people could look right in. Not too noisy because a cool weekend, but if the pool was being used, it would definitely be an issue. Also, bkfst is served around the pool, so if you want to sleep in, definitely don't stay anywhere near the pool. I did peek at the queen rooms, as some reviewers noted, very small, I would not have been happy. Also, bkfst. was by far the worst I have had at any B&B anywhere. Box milk, cereal, yogurt, bagels, dry muffins, juice. A hard boiled egg would have been a great addition. So basically, good location, clean. My advice, shop around. Have stayed at both Conch house and la Pensionne on the same block and old town manor closer in town (I find an excellent value).

Reviews.Title: “The room stank of mold. Air conditioning unit was filthy when we checked”
Reviews.Author: sgoldberg2
Reviews.Content: in. Credit the staff for immediately replacing the a/c unit, but the room was still moldy. I'm not one to complain about smells and mold, but this was bad. Shower was really pathetic, as was the "breakfast," which wasn't worth going to. Rooms are tiny and lack such basics as a coffee pot. The staff tried hard, the location is terrific, but I'd give the Key Line a pass.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, Big Price”
Reviews.Author: rgray2f
Reviews.Content: Like many properties in Key West, it's old expensive and cramped. The standard room is too small for two and their luggage--consistent with Michelin 2 star. Room was clean. Staff was pleasant. Breakfast was uninspired and consistent with a poor Hampton Inn breakfast, but it is served pool side. Wireless internet seems to only work reliably from poolside--reception in the room is spotty. Very conveniently located to Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and quiet”
Reviews.Author: LoriC20
Reviews.Content: The Key Lime in was quite comfortable and the front desk staff was very friendly. Only two things that kept it from being fabulous ... one, is the limited and "pre-packaged" breakfast. Nothing special at all; pre-packaged cereal servings, yogurt and some bagels. Apples, no other fruit. And really lousy coffee. The other was the scratchy polyester pillow cases. Sheets were all cotton and felt wonderful. Very odd! That said, location is great, rooms were spotless, hammocks were plentiful, pool was refreshing and there is off-street parking.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this place!”
Reviews.Author: DanFromHades
Reviews.Content: Key West is my favorite travel destination in the US. Even though you CAN take a connecting flight from Newark, my wife and I prefer to land in MIami, spend a night in SoBe and take a relaxing drive to Key West the next day. We've been staying in the Key Lime Inn the last four years and see no reason to stay anywhere else. The location and price would be hard to beat. We've never stayed in the smaller rooms (actually cottages), but all the guests who've stayed in them seem to be happy. We stay in the suite in the main guest house and love it so much I was hesitant to write a review because we don't want this place to get too well known in fear of "our" room not being available when we're there. Repeat: We LOVE this place!! It feels like as if you're "home" as opposed to staying at a faceless hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KayDewey
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Key Lime Inn and it is just too expensive for what it is. Management would probably say that it is the same as other Inns in that catagory, so I guess they are all too expensive for what they offer. The room is the tiniest I have ever been in. I had to sit on the toilet to write in my journal or pull the single chair up to the sink which is in the bedroom. Then you would have to climb over the chair to get anywhere. Absolutely impossible to move around in. Too cold to go swimming, so that is it, there is nothing else there. As mentioned in other posts, the breakfast is merely packaged foods. Not even hot water to make your own tea. If you are planning to go to Key West to party all night and just need a close bed to fall into, then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: nycswim2012
Reviews.Content: This past December I took a trip down to Key West for the day and night with a friend of mine. Living in Miami, we decided to just drive down without making any reservations, and just to look at different hotels and make a decision upon arrival. Of the 5 or so hotels we walked into-it was clear that the Key Lime Inn was one of the best bed and breakfast type hotels that are very popular in the Key West hospitality industry. The rooms were very clean and worked very well for the purpose of our trip. With Key West being very busy during this season, we were surprised and delighted that we were given a room with all the ammenities we requested. 2 queen size beds, wireless internet access, etc. The front desk agent Vicki was amazing! She was more than happy to assist us with showing rooms and informing us about all the Key West area. She is an employee that is worth keeping! Myself and travel partner are both employees at a five star hotel in Miami Beach, so hospitality is something we know well. The best part of the hotel is that it is right around the corner from Duval street so literally EVERYTHING is within walking distance! We were very pleased with our stay, and it will be the only choice from now on when traveling to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hideaway in the heart of Key West”
Reviews.Author: Janel54171
Reviews.Content: This was clean, charming and close to everything. Once we parked the car we just walked. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “very average, would not go back”
Reviews.Author: KonanTape
Reviews.Content: This may be an unfair sticking point, but here goes: for a bed and breakfast-like establishment, I really think that, at the very least, the breakfast should be nice. I don't understand the American hotel habit of providing generic, processed breakfast foods: plastic package muffins and bagels with Philly cream cheese packets, Kellogg-brand cereals in a small box, old fruit, and cardboard-y brewed coffee. At a Key West establishment for over $200/night, I would think at the very least there could be fresh citrus and fresh baked goods. Maybe some tea? With all the European tourists passing through Key West (and this hotel) I actually felt embarrassed about the kind of food served for breakfast, when in Europe, at even a low-price travelers hostel you get fresh food for breakfast. The rooms were clean and pleasant, but quite small again considering the price. And rooms are packed together with thin walls, so we heard the amorous activities of our neighbors on both sides. I understand that it's Key West and I'm happy for couples experiencing rekindled romance, but it shouldn't make you feel like you're in a motel 6. The pool was clean but too cold for comfortable swimming (the weather was also cool for swimming, but if the pool had been properly heated it would have been fine). The four nights we were there I never saw anyone swimming. The two women I met at the front desk were very helpful in helping book plans for the day. The first was rather curt and unfriendly at check-in, though, which was strange. The location is very good - close to everything but not at all noisy. The parking was also convenient. Overall, however, I found this inn over-priced and completely lacking any kind of personal touch or pleasant surprises. I definitely would not come back here but would look for another hotel to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: CGAdams
Reviews.Content: The Key Lime Inn is in a great location, a short walk to Duval Street, and has free parking. The Inn is composed of several "cottages" and it's very neat and well-kept. The room was nice and tastefully done, and the bed was very comfortable. There's not a lot of road noise (we stayed near the back, away from the street), although there's a rooster that wanders around the property, and he crows in the early morning (there seem to be an awful lot of chickens in Key West, for whatever reason...). The woman at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. Overall, we would definitely return for a second visit!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not $300 per night, nice.”
Reviews.Author: vacationadict
Reviews.Content: Clean, but run down a bit. No extra pillows, no blanket at all. Hot water for only 5 minutes of your shower. Totally uninspired breakfast. So many great places to eat in Key West, no reason to have very boring 'free' continental. Hotel is crazy noisy too, roosters have no idea what time it is...

Reviews.Title: “The Key Lime Inn Was Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: jonesmissydog
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the Key Lime Inn and its staff for making our first visit to Key West so enjoyable. Even though we were there during record breaking cold temperatures, we had a lot of fun . I cant speak of how the A/C worked, but there is a heat setting and that worked great. The reception staff is so nice and professional, and helped us find places to eat and things to do, one of which was going on the haunted trolley tour and meeting Robert the Doll...eeeek! The Key Lime inn is very close to Duval Street and Mallory square is walkable if we did not want to take a cab and there is a CVS a block away and lots of places to eat. We saw and heard the ubiquitous roosters every morning, but they add to the charm of the place and there were ear plugs provided, but we did not use them. The breakfast by the pool is a nice way to start the day. I as sad to leave Key West, but look forward to coming back , and I will definitly stay at the Key Lime Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Major_Buddy_Pete
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at Key Lime Inn and enjoyed the room, the staff and the convenient location. Everything was just around the corner - bicycle rental, food and Duval street. Staff made solid recommendations for dining and possible attractions to see. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Key Lime Inn is absolutely charming.”
Reviews.Author: BellaDonnaSails
Reviews.Content: Nestled away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street, we found the Key Lime Inn to be quite distinctive. We had a second floor room with a covered porch. With our door opened, it almost felt like we were in a tree house. It was magical and charming. The staff was very helpful and friendly and accommodating. We would definitely consider another stay at the Key Lime Inn or the sister property next door The Chelsea House. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Room was great & the people were the same.”
Reviews.Author: HappyD0783
Reviews.Content: This was the first time at the Key Lime Inn we found it to be a very pleasent experiance. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a dehumidifier”
Reviews.Author: RichDaddy
Reviews.Content: After having nothing but great experiences with this B&B in the past I have decided to never go there again. I made a reservation for this hotel a week in advance and they charged my card full rate as if I had checked in. I got the best room they have, and I was very disappointed with the dampness of the room. I had the most uncomfortable sleep I have ever paid for. in my life. The sheets were soo damp. The next morning I couldn't put my flip flops on because they were soaked. I live in Florida and don't have that problem at my house.(Check out girl told me its a florida thing, She sounded Russian?) The size of the Tv is the size of my laptop screen!!! No tubs in your room? Sorry to see this one off my list of places to stay in the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything about the Key Lime Inn and would recommend it to anyone - It was perfect for my daughter and I!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel30471
Reviews.Content: Our cottage was adorable, comfortable and very clean. The Key Lime Inn is convenient to everything in KW. The entire staff helped us on many occasions with directions, maps, dinner reservations and information. Onsite parking and the breakfast each morning was also very helpful! We loved the Key Lime Inn and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Cottage room was great, very new and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Laddie22
Reviews.Content: The place has been recently updated and was very nice with new wood floors and all new bathroom etc. We stayed in one of the cottage rooms, like having your own little house! People were friendly and breakfast was standard fare of bagels etc. A little far from the heart of Duval St...although this may be fine for many people. We would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here”
Reviews.Author: AlphaMikePapa
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, just 2 minutes from Duval Street. Friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel, alot of charm , great location.”
Reviews.Author: scherip
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here last year at the same time for the powerboat races. the cottage we had was adorable. This time there was a moldy smell in there if we just had the fan on so we either had to have the a/c full blast, or the heat to dry out the dampness. I have allergies. It wasn't horrible, but i enjoyed my stay last year and it was in a different cottage., and the only problem to me was the moldy smell this time...

Reviews.Title: “Our 4th Stay Here! Each time is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Marc19002
Reviews.Content: As the title says, this is our 4th time staying here. No negatives whatsoever. The staff is super friendly. The room we always stay in (#4) has a very large bathroom with a huge shower. The A/C works great and so does the heat (it was in the low 40's at night while in Key West this time!). There is a small outside sitting area right outside the back door. The location is 2 blocks off of Duval. Not stumbling home super drunk from the bars if that is you, but only a $7 can ride from zero Duval vacinity. Nice breakfast spread but we always ate breakfast out. Free wireless available but you may have to sit outside depending on your room location. Even the rooster semi-cooperated this year as I didn't hear him at his usual 3AM calling.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, good location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: metlc
Reviews.Content: Located right on US Route 1 just a couple of blocks off Duval Street. Not on the water like some of the fancier hotels. More of a bungalow motel than a hotel. Good outdoor breakfast by the pool. Room was recently remodeled; simple, spare and clean. Limited parking, so get there early or you'll park across the street next to the Catholic church (my churchgoing wife appreciated that).

Reviews.Title: “The Key Lime Inn is outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: ephartnett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Key Lime Inn for 3 nights. We had initially tried to book a room at a nearby inn but they insisted on a 5 night minimum. This was our good fortune because we then found the Key Lime Inn online. First, the staff is top notch. Vicky and Robert at the front desk were especially helpful and accomodating but all the staff were friendly and welcoming. Make sure to ask them for their recommendations on restaurants, bike routes, local bars, etc. Next, we highly recommend the cottage rooms. They resemble small bungalows but the furnishings inside are modern and very comfortable. Next, the location of the inn is perfect. It's close enough (3 blocks) to all the fun on Duval Street but far enough away to have a restful stay. We spent half of one day on bikes touring the island and the other half relaxing by the pool. The Inn is not on a commercial strip, it's part of a residential neighborhood which is part of its charm. Next, the continental breakfast is nothing fancy (coffee, juice, yogurt, bagels, toast, cereal, etc) but it is ample and nicely laid out by the pool. The only small downside to the inn is the small parking lot. If you get a spot, parking is free. If not, there is street parking nearby. We parked our car and left it in the spot for 4 days. There was no need for it. We walked or rode bikes whenever we went out. When we return to Key West we will definitely stay at the Key Lime Inn. It is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: screenburn
Reviews.Content: Key Lime Inn was exactly what I was looking for. The front desk staff was sooo friendly and competent. The price was excellent. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and modern. It's weird, but the Inn was only 3 blocks from the action, but it was quiet, relaxing and private. Each room had a guaranteed (free) parking spot. I highly recommend Key Lime Inn for the middle-class traveler looking for a relaxing get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Key Lime in the middle of Key West”
Reviews.Author: Muthatrucka
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the Key Lime Inn, I only wish the weather had treated us better during our stay. The rooms are basically individual cottages, and as such it all feels very private which is nice. They laid on breakfast by the pool each morning, which is something a lot of the hotels on our trip didn't do! The staff were really nice and the hotel is about a 5 minute from Duval Street and everything that is on offer there, so you couldn't want for a better location. If I ever go again, and I hope I do I will book the Key Lime - no question.

Reviews.Title: “If there was no chickens!!”
Reviews.Author: masscurl
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely little spot. Very cute and relaxing. They have a nice location, nice individual cottages. Rooms are very cute and clean. Chickens running around free, and thought that was cute. But in the middle of the night when rooster start going on it wasn't very relaxing anymore. I like sleeping late and was awake every night around 4.30 with chickens noise. And another minus one for me the church accross the street. If you are there for sunday morning jst make sure you get up early otherwise you'll be jumping off your bed with high volume church bells. My other problem was when we booked I booked room with a fridge, paid extra money. When we get the room all they have was a wine cooler type fridge instead of a regular mini fridge you expect to see. So we thought I guess this is cool enough. We put our stuff in it (some deli meat, cheese and drinks). Next day when we wanted to use it we realized that wasn't a fridge to cool enough so our stuff was ruined. When I copmlaint they give me back my $20 I paid extra but when I said you advertise fridge so brought food, and they ruined, what about my expenses. I was told nothing they can do about it. So this was a upset for me and reason I won't go back here again. But if you pass that noise and fridge issue it's a cute place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Clark12908
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time I have stayed at the Key Lime Inn and am booked again for next October. It is perfectly located. You can walk to all the action of DuVal St. and still have a quiet, comfortable place to retreat to. You are also located near by churches and convenience stores (so you can stock up on your way in). Staff is extremely friendly and hotel grounds are charming, even the roosters. Continental breakfast is great. It would be nice to have a common grille to cook on. This is one of our favorite vacation spots and we have recommended many friends and had no negative feedback.

Reviews.Title: “A Great hotel - wold reccomend!”
Reviews.Author: JN_hampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Key Lime Inn for 3 nights and we cannot rate the hotel any higher than 5 stars. The hotel staff were extremely helpful, friendly and only too pleased to help. The location is perfect, with it being out of busy Duval street, but close enough to be near to it and all the best parts of Key West. The rooms are comfortable, clean and spacious. We were sad to leave and would definitely come back again if we go to Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “Key Lime Inn was comfortable, clean, and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: RmblinRose
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful with suggesting local restaurants and activities. Room was clean and cozy. Short walk to downtown, quiet off of main strip. Sunny pool surrounded by rooms. Liked outdoor continental breakfast by the pool, only negative-bed was a little firm. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!”
Reviews.Author: Coltsrock
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend trip to Key West in which we stayed at the Key Lime Inn for two nights. I booked based on reviews, location, and price. It seemed like such a good value, and it was! The rooms are little cottages and are very cute and private. I was surprised because the rooms looked nicer and more updated than what I had seen in the photos. My only complaint, if you even want to call it that, was the slight musty odor in the rooms. In this humid climate, it does happen. We found that just turning the a/c to make it colder did the trick. We had the a/c on the low setting and it was freezing! It really, really worked well. The beds were comfortable and the breakfast by the pool in the morning was convenient. They were very friendly at the front desk as well and gave us helpful info on sunset cruises and things to do on the island. I would definitely go back again. With a 5 minute walking distance to Duval but none of the noise, it was the perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place just far enough from Duval St”
Reviews.Author: flyfifer11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at end Sept for 4 nights in a deluxe room. Check in was quick and easy. Free parking on site. Never had to move the car for the 4 days as everything is close to hand. Duval St is a 5 minute walk away with all the pubs & restuarants you will need. The room also has a small fridge (located in shower/toilet, bit weird) and a coffee maker. there is a CVS shop just across the road if you want any supplies for the fridge. Had a lovely little pool with free pool towels & a complimentary breakfast which is set up at the sitting area next to the pool. Breakfast was basic, cereals, toast, bagels, muffins, Coffee but what more do you need. Atmosphere was very relaxed and place was very clean. Beds really comfy. Duval street is the hub of Key west and is worth it just to see all the strange people that you encounter. went to a little bar called the Rum runner and encountered very friendly staff who recommended places to eat etc. Key west is a place where it can be as hectic or relaxed as you want. There are always cruise ships coming & going and the prices tend to be more expensive at that end of town where they dock. A few of the pubs have entertainment on most days and some are good and some need a medal for getting on stage in the first place. I would have no problem going back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Key West.....Totally Relaxed”
Reviews.Author: tannerd1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at our usual place, The Key Lime Inn on our semi annual trip to Key West. We love the service and atmosphere. Fantastic!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: Ian024
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here for a week and it was one of the most relaxing places I've stayed in. Its a great location within 5 minutes walking distance of Duval Street which is the main street in Key West. The rooms are very clean and roomy authentic cigar makers cottagers. The only small problem is the road running past the hotel so you get the sound of traffic as you sit by the pool. But this is only a minor problem and shouldn't spoil the enjoyment of a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: 3NolesMom
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. The room looks to be recently updated. Comfortable bed and icy cold a/c. The staff was attentive, friendly and helpful. Definitely would stay here again when we return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, good overall”
Reviews.Author: DnL524
Reviews.Content: The good stuff first: the Key Lime Inn is an attractive, slightly quaint-feeling collection of small buildings (feels sort of cottagey) a couple of blocks from Duval Street - perfect for easy access to everything on foot, but far enough away to avoid the noise. The room was very nicely sized (it was their superior queen room) with a mini-fridge and very comfy beds. Everything was very clean and well-kept. There's a free breakfast served on the pool patio: fairly basic, bagels and muffins and the like. The staff was polite and helpful. I called ahead to let them know I'd be arriving late (after midnight) and they gave me all necessary instructions to pick up my key from the night manager. Vicki had plenty of good recommendations and gave me a handy street map. The not as good stuff: the room had a slightly odd shower - couldn't quite maneuver the shower head to actually be over my head, so I had to either angle it sideways or take it off its hook and hold it in one hand. Not a big deal, just annoying. Parking is very limited (maybe 15 spaces or so), but there's a good deal of free street parking on Truman. There was also a very slightly odd smell in the room. Not strong enough for us to bother with complaining, and I imagine it's very difficult to avoid some small amount of mildew in the Keys, but there it is. Also, whatever cleaners the housekeeping staff used, they didn't smell great. That said, how much time do you spend sniffing at your hotel room in a place like Key West anyway? This is a great hotel. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. I'd recommend you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Like staying in a B&B!”
Reviews.Author: TheycalledmeAlice
Reviews.Content: I loved the privacy and how clean and neat the grounds were. Perfect for my first real vacation. I heard alot about the "roosters" and while I did see some while in Key West, I never heard a peep! Given the fact that it was August, it was really hot which made the long walk to all the action places on Duval pretty tough. Had the weather been a bit cooler, the walk wouldn't have been bad at all. The pool was a nice place to sit at in the morning and in the eve (even though it closed at 10pm I sat with feet in anyway). The pool water was very warm so not good on the refreshing factor (except my tired feet at night). All in all, it was a great place and I'd definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Location to Explore Key West”
Reviews.Author: Grayola
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in advance on the stregth of Trip Advisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is close to Duval Street and Mallory Square is within walking distance but it is far enough away to be away from the roudiness of the bars and clubs. Room are comformatble and very 'old south' but with modern facilities. The inclusive breakfasts by the pool are very nice and staff are very friendly and helpful. Free on site parking is plentiful, which is a bonus in the area. A great place to stay for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Key Lime Inn was Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: JudalineC
Reviews.Content: My Husband I stayed at the Key Lime Inn in celebration of our 40th Wedding Anniversery. Location was excellant (2 blocks off Duval St, on the quiet end). We were able to walk to all sites along Duval St easily. The Inn was staffed by very nice and helpful people. Our room was great. We had room 36, a small cabin type room.......large bedroom with sitting area, flat screen TV and bathroom with coffee maker and small refriderator. The bed was extremly comfortable and the A/C worked perfectly in the hot August days! Our room was located off the deck and the pool was just outside our door. Breakfast was supplied with the room and served on the pool deck each morning. We had a very pleasant visit and would highly recommend it to anyone who visits Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful and nice place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: stephanie014
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Key Lime Inn for 2 nights and we enjoyed it a lot. Ideally placed (10mn walking from Duvall street), nice, quite place, good service.........and such a beautiful swimming pool. We came with our 10 months baby: good place to go with all the family. Key Lime Inn is definitivelÃ±y a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore Key West and Duvall Street”
Reviews.Author: Greg50Madison
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at the Key Lime Inn based on a friend's recommendation and that of other Trip Advisor reviews. It was easy to find, right on US1, just two short blocks off Duvall Street. It was close enought to park our car, check in and walk to Duvall and down to Mallory Square and back. Very nice and courteous with a generous breakfast poolside.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a cute inn!”
Reviews.Author: BeachLiz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this location because we wanted to be near Duval, but not ON Duval. This location was excellent! We were greeted by a very friend desk clerk (guy from Michigan) who was extremely helpful during our stay from July 27-29. Our room was very clean and quiet, no issues at all. We were located in the back of the property (room 14--have attached pic), and we remained parked at the inn for two days so we wouldn't lose our parking spot. Parking is limited and tight, and I'd advise any visitor to bring a smaller car. We brought a mid-size sedan, and we were glad we did not bring my large truck! As others mentioned, there IS a wild rooster which lives nearby that likes to crow non-stop; we heard him from 3 a.m. until we got up. OHH, he was like clockwork! Started right at 3 a.m. both nights. But, there are wild roosters EVERYWHERE nearby and this will be an issue at any place right in town. So, be sure to bring ear plugs because he is LOUD!!! The rowdy rooster is not the inn's fault though :) He's just being a rooster, I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Key West Comfort”
Reviews.Author: dbarnett63
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a Key West visit. I have stayed in several Bed and Breakfasts in town and this was one of the best. The location is a little far for the normal daily walks but fine if you are on a bike. It is very clean with nice grounds. The pool is very relaxing and a great size by Key West standards. The rooms are modern with refrigerators and nice skylights. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a nice, updated place near Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Charm”
Reviews.Author: bernali
Reviews.Content: Convenient location to Duval Street and tennis courts. Pool was too warm for summer so couldn't really enjoy it. Good continental breakfast. Patronizing local black-owned businesses is important to us on our trips and the Inn had no information regarding businesses owned by local African-Americans...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Good Location, Nice Amenities”
Reviews.Author: demers669
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights midweek and have a wonderful time. The free parking sealed the deal for us, but we ended up in a king deluxe room which was a small cottage (room #16). It was close to the pool and area where continental breakfast was served. Yet there were other cottages which helped to block any noise from Truman Ave. This was our first visit to Key West and the choice of places to stay can numb you. You will not go wrong staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean place to stay! Friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: SkinnyB42
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before going to our weekend getaway. I picked the Key Lime Inn because it seemed to have a good location (close to everything but not too close), the price was right, it was clean, and had parking. When we arrived, in my husbands truck, there was only on parking spot left and it was too small for the truck to fit. There was free parking on the street close by so it wasn't that bad. Just keep in mind that parking is limited and if you have an option of driving a smaller car it might be worth it. We booked a smaller queen size room as this was all that was available when I made the reservation. The room was small but clean and very cute. It even had it's own outside area. The problem was that is was practically on the road or at least that's the way it sounded when we were trying to fall asleep. My husband complained but the inn was completely booked for the night. The staff tried to get us a room at one of there other hotels but there was only one available. It seemed like a lot of trouble to move so we decided to stay the night and they moved us into another room for the next night. This room was very nice and very quiet. If you are a light sleeper I would request a room away from the street. The first room we stayed in was #1. I would stay away from room #1, #2, and #3, and #37 due to the close proximitly to the road. Overall we were happy. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, the pool was nice, and the breakfast was good and free.

Reviews.Title: “We are going back again for the 5th time”
Reviews.Author: YlangylangFlorida
Reviews.Content: We ADORE this place! It is our yearly getaway spot. I am not a good traveler. I do not like to touch doorknobs, bedspreads, phones, or anything that may harbor germs, yet I feel perfectly at home here. It is clean, the decor is very Key West, great breakfast (free!), and the surroundings truly give the feel of "long ago, tropical". I'd recommend this one 100%.

Reviews.Title: “First-time visitors...sold for life!”
Reviews.Author: beazbrown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend in Key West, and spent 3 nights at the Key Lime Inn at the recommendation of our travel agent. We couldn't have been more pleased! Knowing beforehand that it was a "historic" hotel, we weren't 100% sure what to expect, but what we discovered went above and beyond what we had in mind. Just 2 blocks from the "start" of the main section of Duvall St., yet far enough away to have a quiet, and very quaint place to retreat. We stayed in room 38 on the end of the property. The room was extremely clean and the bathroom was so clean it almost seemed new. It was a large room and we enjoyed the private patio out back. Breakfast was served each morning poolside, and for 2 people who aren't big breakfast eaters..the pastries, yogurt, fruit, juice, & coffee was a great start to each day...and a huge cost saver in a place where there are no fast food-type establishments. The pool is nothing fancy in comparison to those at the large beach resorts we're used back home, but given the size of the hotel it was perfect & was great to stop by in the afternoon and just relax under a palm tree in the quiet. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at Key Lime and will stay again when we make our next trip....hopefully sooner than later!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Retiredfolks
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying here and another relaxing vacation. The location is perfect for anything you want to do in Key West. Just park your car and forget about it for your stay. You can easily walk to everything. My room was clean and perfect as usual. The breakfast around the pool is a great time to compare notes with other travelers and plan your day. I will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Our Oasis in the sun”
Reviews.Author: ebkozie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room #37 which had plenty of space and had all the amenities that we were looking for. As a bonus it opened up to the pool deck which made it convenient, along with the continental breakfast which was set-up at the far side of the pool every morning. The off street parking was great because we could leave our car there all week becuse we were within walking distance to Duval St. where all the restaurants and shops are located. If and when we come back to Key West, the Key Lime Inn will be on the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Great Staff / and Great Room”
Reviews.Author: LifeOfVacations
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and couldn't have been happier with the overall visit. Location was excellent, room clean and quiet, and the staff friendly and helpful. Couldn't have asked for more and got it at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful place to stay--not luxurious, but comfortable and quaint.”
Reviews.Author: Wes3637
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Key West, we were looking for a hotel close to downtown at a reasonable rate with off-street parking. Key Lime Inn met our expectations for the money. Our room was a cabin with a door to the outside. While the furniture was old and a mix of styles, the room was clean and most comfortable. The staff we dealt with with were courteous, friendly, and accommodating. The swimming pool was nice. I would choose Key Lime Inn on another trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Key Lime Inn - perfect for experiencing Key West”
Reviews.Author: LastFlightOut21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Key Lime Inn. Check in was fast and friendly, our room was perfect and it is a great location to experience all that Key West has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: garypjones
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nites and were very pleased. We were in cabin 19, clean and neat. Just right for 2. Qn bed, table and chairs, flat screen tv, fridge and coffee maker. No tub but large walk in shower. Room is not large but sufficient. Staff very friendly and helpful. They even printed my boarding passes for me. Very quiet here as all vehicles are in a parking lot near office so you don't have pedistrian traffic parading in front of your lodgings. Very clean pool!

Reviews.Title: “Key Lime is Key West at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: etoft
Reviews.Content: A lovely, peaceful and perfect Inn with great staff and service! Superb poolside rooms with private entries and "new" friends!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay when visiting key west”
Reviews.Author: ajarljs7
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here while seeing the sights in key west. Very close to Duval, but the few blocks distance makes it nice and quiet except for the rooster which likes to crow at 6:00 am daily. Room was clean but small. The mattress was not so good. Staff was very helpful. The breakfast was very simple. It was just toast, bagels, english muffins, cereal etc, but served outside near the pool. Nice setting when the weather is good but not so good the morning it rained. We had a nice little porch area with lots of foliage that made a great place to have morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Our visit at the Key Lime Inn was delightful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maryella96
Reviews.Content: We felt that the Key Lime Inn really gave us a feel for Key West. It was close to everything. We rented bikes and appreciated the convenient bike racks. The staff were helpful. The pool clean and relaxing! We couldn't have asked for a better place. We missed the Roosters when we got home.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: paw45
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to the Keys. We drove 4.5 hours to the Keys from our home in Palm Beach Gardens, FL. A real "Island" retreat. Many, many shops..if you like fun, boutique clothing, be sure to go to "French Kiss" on Duval St...also wonderful restaurants. Lovely lunch at the Westin (on the water) and an incredible Veal dish at Martins on Duval Street. A very diverse community..young and old and kind of like a "Bourbon Street" atmosphere...lively and friendly . The group sunsets were interesting, but give me my own sunset. next time. Loved being able to walk from our Inn to the many places..great that it was quiet there at night. It was about a 5-15 minute walk to most places, including the sunset, shops and cemetary...a must see. If you love water sports and fishing..it will become a desitnation for you. Everyone should see this place at least once in their lifetime!....p and j ps...we had requested a top floor room at the Inn, but because of availability, they only had a single cottage available.. while even though it was handicap accesible, we enjoyed the room for it was very spacious and pleasant had a patio by the pool! Lovely! Enjoy your visit..p &j

Reviews.Title: “What is that odor?”
Reviews.Author: nana_10_10
Reviews.Content: The room itself was clean looking. Freshly painted. White and lime color. Bright. Pleasant. looking. When you walked out of the bathroom into the bedroom there was a terrible odor. The air conditioner kept the room cool but did not remove humidity so the smell may have been mold. We stayed 2 nights and we had a great time at Key West and the room was bearable(we did not complain so do not know if they would have moved us) but we were glad to leave it. We paid $159 per night. Would not return there. The people who worked there were all nice and they probably would have moved us but it was full it seemed and we did not feel like moving all our stuff.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: JacobsBaltimore
Reviews.Content: The Key Lime was great. The grounds were beautiful, the rooms neat & clean! Great afternoons at the pool. Staff was helpful and always friendly! Rooster was a pest but brought home 4 pictures of him so he couldn't have been that bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: stanleya13693
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 days at the Key Lime and we were very pleased with the accommodations Their continental breakfast in the morning has a very good menu.. It is located 2 blocks from Doval St. and walking distance to Ernest Hemmingways house plus most other attractions. It is about a 15 minute walk to the site for the sunset celebration, which if you go you should not miss. The staff was very helpful and accommodating with getting information on the local events. We will definitely be staying there the next we go to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: kc0698
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just loved this little B&B. Close enough to the hot spots but far enough away to relax. The pool was great. I'd been to Key West years before but this was my partners first visit. We will stay at the Key Lime in the future and rent my scooter form Pirate Scooters and have a drink at the Green Parrot ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: DennisNewnan_GA
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a piece of paradise only a few blocks from downtown Key West, look no further. The location of this hotel makes it easy to walk to every old town attraction but it is so secluded that you can sit by the pool undisturbed. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: Taffman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of Key West, within easy walking distance of all the main sights and entertainment. It has free parking. We had a King suite, in a little bungalow alongside the pool. Considering its downtown location, it was quiet and the bed was REALLY comfortable. The room was spotlessly clean and had a coffee maker and a refrigerator.Bathroom decor was a little tired though. A nice complimentary continental breakfast is served by the poolside each morning. This hotel has character and heart, its friendly staff make you feel welcome and I would definately recommend it, particularly if you are looking for something different from the usual hotel box room. Thanks Key Lime Inn for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: flashfeeder
Reviews.Content: We were hardly aware of street sounds and of other people staying there, and loved our encounters with "Rodney the Rooster"! Room was clean and comfortable, loved the patio outside our door, staff was most helpful and knowledgable. Such a nice breakfast by the pool. Easy walk to Duval Street, good restaurants close-by, on-site parking was a blessing. Take the tram ride to see Key West; some of the drivers will tell you why there are roosters in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “NO PARKING ON SITE - FREE PARKING MEANS THE STREET!!”
Reviews.Author: Sputnik_10
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it advertised free parking. When I arrived, the only space available was the handicap space. I drove around and came back and parked in the space to check-in or I would have had to roll my luggage a mile down the street. The staff was very flippant about the parking. I mentioned that their ad stated there was free parking. They laughed and said, there is on the street. This was not very comforting as I was alone and had to get up in the dark to go to work. The rest of the stay was the same way. The rooms are bare essentials-not even an ad for a restaurant. Everything is quite old including the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: miata68
Reviews.Content: It is a great location, only a few blocks from Duval street. We stayed in #2, a separate cabin near Truman The room was small, but very quaint and cozy. The bathroom was small, but functional. There were no surprises and on site parking was available. You will hear roosters in the morning, but so what, it makes the stay even more entertaining. I slept through it the 2nd morning. The staff was helpful in selecting places to eat, and Sunny's deli is a must stop.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Old Town location, unique property”
Reviews.Author: thunderfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in mid-March, really liked the fact that it is in Old Town, the staff we encountered we're all helpful and pleasant (except 1 morning desk clerk seemed rather unfriendly, but I only asked her 1 question). We liked the Caribbean village feel of the inn, our room was fine, except maybe the inn could look at upgrading/replacing the beds/pillows, bed was little too soft and the pillows a little stiff (don't mean to sound like Goldilocks!). Yes, the rooster does crow at all hours, but the A/C unit helped drown his sound out and if you're afraid the rooster noises will bother you, bring along some ear plugs. But there's hardly anywhere you'll go in Key West where you won't hear roosters. The bathroom was fine for our standards, I believe most of the rooms have only showers (no bath tubs), but are you really looking to luxuriate in a bath tub while in Key West anyway? Shower had a little mildew on the wall at the floor level where the curtain touches the wall. The breakfast by the pool was nice, mostly bagels, english muffins, danish, breads and yogurt. (If you're looking for a more hearty and filling breakfast walk a few blocks to Camille's on Simonton St.) The walk to the harbor and Mallory Square takes 15-20 minutes but if you don't want to walk along Duval then try Elizabeth or Simonton streets, both streets providing a nice walk past old homes. Once you park you car (if you're lucky enough to get a spot in the lot), leave it there and walk, rent a bike or scooter. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would return even with the slightly uncomfortable bed situation.

Reviews.Title: “Always sunny!!”
Reviews.Author: ontimeHuron_OH
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Key Lime Inn for a quick get away. We had stayed a few years past at the Lighthouse Court and enjoyed it very much.We wanted to try another property. The hotel was clean and quaint. The price was right, didn't have to pay a crazy amount for one night in Key West. Not a bad walk from Duval St. and we made the walk several times down to Sloppy Joe's. We would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ContessaMaryland
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the Key Lime Inn. It is very close to everything, especially Duvall St. The staff is very friendly. We had to cut our stay by a day due to the snowstorms up north, the staff was very understanding and had no problem with the cancellation. The hotel is clean, but honestly our mattress was a little old and could probably be replaced, but even with that. we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time spent at the Key Lime Inn”
Reviews.Author: x28tango1
Reviews.Content: Check in went smooth even though we arrived early. The cottage that was provided was exceptionally clean and quiet. We had a cottage almost on Truman Avenue but it was so well insulated that you could hear no traffic while inside the room. The staff was friendly and interactive, making certain that you had everything you needed and were also more than happy to help you plan an itinerary. I would add that, when you park, leave your car and take the tram or walk, parking is a premium commodity in Key West, not necessarily a detriment ot the hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “UGG!”
Reviews.Author: Nation_traveler
Reviews.Content: I have never given a poor review ever before on any site. This was my fifth trip to Key West and I have always wanted to stay at the Key Lime Inn, it looks so quaint---and what do you know it was as quaint as a girls camp cabin in New Hampshire. We stayed in the superior queen room. I was underwhelmed to say the least. For the $200.00 per night I paid--all I can say is --ugg! The room is really plain. The Bathroom (which is just the toilet and the shower) gets the biggest ugg, as the toilet rocked back and forth, the shower had water damage around it. The bed was beat up like crazy and the granite pillows were... well, uncomfortable would be the best description. The outside looks totally run down, with a coat of fresh paint on it! The smell was rather cabinesque and/or mildewish--ugg. We had to park on the street, as all the parking was taken. Luckily it is across the street from the Catholic Church and so the street parking was free. The most amazing part was when we returned and they had made up the room, the windows were wide open, with no screen on them. Wow-- they are much more trusting than I would be. I didn't really like it

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: rbccalhoun
Reviews.Content: We picked the Key Lime Inn mainly because it had free parking which is hard to find in Key West and the rates were pretty reasonable for this time of year. We stayed in Room 5 which had french doors that open to a private little sitting area. The bed was high off the ground, large and very comfortable. Our room had a mini fridge, great TV, and an adequate shower, good air conditioning and a ceiling fan. This room was in the back of the inn so we did not hear any street noise at all. The pool area is great-we sat out there at night and enjoyed the free wifi. Coffee, juice, and breads were served in the morning poolside. We never moved our car and walked everywhere. The Key Lime Inn is in a convenient location for anything you want to do in Key West. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: banjaraa
Reviews.Content: very nice cottage accomodation.. but the room and bathroom had some ant infestation so we had to be careful about food and drinks in the room we were in the superior queen n found the bed/mattress very comfortable, except the bed was a bit creaky, but we got used to it after the first night great location.. we just walked to duval and old town, but you can rent bikes from nearby places too the person at the reception was nice, but they were trying to sell a snorkelling trip which we would hv gone for anyway, but when they repeated this, we were put off when we booked though their website, they asked if it was for a special occasion, n we mentioned it was our anniversary, so we expected some special treatment, but there was none. that's probably the only real disappointment otherwise, we wouldnt hesitate to recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beachlover325
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Key Lime Inn January 7-10, 2010. Despite the record breaking cold temps we had a great time. The location is great. It is a short walk to Duval Street and lots of restaurants, shops and bars. A 24 hour Denny's is right down the street, as is a 24 hour CVS (along with a Papa Johns and Subway in the same complex). We rented bikes just around the corner and the inn had a bike rack where you could park them. We didn't have a car so we didn't have to worry about parking. We walked or biked everywhere and enjoyed it. Our room was #18, a stand alone cottage that had its own little deck and private bathroom. I personally found the bed uncomfortable (a bit too hard for me) and the linens are very cheap and scratchy. There was a sofa, chair and coffee table, along with a flat screen TV, king size bed and two nightstands. The bathroom was pretty basic and had a shower. One big thing I didn't like was that there wasn't much hot water. Even when I was trying to be very conservative and save hot water for my husband the hot water ran out, and I was in there for less than 10 minutes. I could see in the summer how this wouldn't be a big deal but it was pretty chilly so this was one downside to the room. The fridge and coffee pot are in the bathroom to the left of the shower. We had little bugs running around by ours (again it's Florida so no big deal really) but after I got rid of them once they seemed to stay away. Overall, this inn isn't anything fancy but is in a nice location and has comfortable accomodations. Don't expect five stars or anything but the staff are friendly and the pool looked nice (too cold to swim). They also offered a complimentary breakfast but we never made it to that. There are roosters around, we kept seeing one during the day who would crow at random times. He will also wake you up early in the morning, but he stops after a few minutes so it's not really a big deal. If anyone has any questions please message me!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, well located, with free parking”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Key Lime Inn during some of the record breaking cold weather. The room was comfortably warm; although the continental breakfast by the pool was a little nippy. During warm weather it would be lovely. The inn staff was helpful and pleasant. It is about a 25 minute walk from the Inn to Mallory Square, with many restaurants along the way. And yes, free parking at the inn, a great amenity. The is not a fancy place, it is comfortable, convenient and good value. Carolyn Salmon

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: stopor
Reviews.Content: The delux room was ok,but stark, towels were very ruff and harsh. The room could use some decorating in any style.. The walls were plain paint..... Te Rooster got up at 5am every monrning!!!! They have to do something!!! Parking not available for all cars

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way!”
Reviews.Author: linandrich
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West, and we loved the city as well as The Key Lime Inn and will stay here again when we return. The cottage is clean and comfortable and more than roomy enough. The location is perfect; walkable to anywhere but not in the midst of the Duval Street hustle-bustle. I can't say enough about how great the front desk staff are! From directions to recommendations to repairs, everyone was so helpful and friendly. I got sick and needed medical attention and the receptionist phoned a doctor who made a house call to our room within 15 minutes; couldn't have been more convenient! The free parking was another bonus in addition to an excellent room rate! The only negative is the continental breakfast. If you love carbs, you're in business; otherwise, a bit lacking. Even some peanut butter would have been welcome.

Reviews.Title: “great location, comfort and value”
Reviews.Author: wanderer1972
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be charming and welcoming. The location couldn't be beat. It was central and withing walking distance to popular spots. It was however far enough away to escape noise. The rooms were small but accomodating. There was a continental breakfast in the morning and coffee/tea available throughout the day and that was good enough for me!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location - both the Key Lime Inn and Key West itself exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Moose-beast
Reviews.Content: A really attractive complex of buildings with a central reception located next to the pool. Staff were very welcoming and helpful and gave us excellent suggestions on which restaurants we might like to try. The dedicated parking area was a real plus point and even when the car park was full we were easily able to park across the road (no charge). The self service breakfast next to the pool was pleasant and the choice of bread, cakes and yogurts enough for us. Our room was lovely with a big, comfortable bed and with excellent air conditioning - much needed in the hottest winter on record. We would have liked a bath (apparently none of the rooms have a bath) but having said that the large shower was fine. My only complaint with the room was that one of the 2 windows didn't have shutters so the light from the porch meant the room was very light in the night. The hotel is set in a great location, back off the road so very quiet at night and only minutes walk from a number of excellent restaurants including on Duval Street where many of the art galleries, shops and bars/restaurants are located. We had originally booked for 2 nights but so liked the hotel and Key West itself that we stayed an extra night - and would have been happy to stay a lot longer had time not been restricted. If we return to Florida we would love to return to Key West and highly recommend the Key Lime Inn to other holiday makers/business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: essexgirlNewcastleUK
Reviews.Content: Booked this based on Lonely Planet recommendation as we didn't want to stay in a chain and liked the idea of an older property. Stayed for a week in a deluxe "cottage" in the grounds. The property offered free parking (on a first come first served basis) to guests. We didn't need to use our car for the entire week as it was a short walk to Duval Street and all other attractions - we even walked to Fort Zachary Taylor State Park although others might prefer to drive. The pool was small but fine for a relaxing swim, and the breakfast (included) was served daily by the pool area. The only downsides were that the decor was getting a bit dated, and we found that during some heavy thunderstorms rain came in via the aircon unit and patio doors and soaked the carpet. Also there was a resident rooster that crowed each morning from about 4 - 7 a.m. - except some nights when it forgot the time and started at 11 p.m.! Not really the fault of the owners though as roosters are common all over Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A nice tropical venue in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Troprocker
Reviews.Content: We had a great time during our stay at the Key Lime Inn the second week of November 2009. Great service from the staff, clean rooms and a great continental breakfast. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a Tropical environment away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hideaway to relax and have fun”
Reviews.Author: lmarnold36
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Key Lime Inn. We really like the laid back feel of the property. The little cabins are adorable. We stayed in the larger house but our friend that came with us stayed in one of the stand alone cottages and loved it. It is bit of a walk to the North end of Duval (where most of the bars and shops are) but was never an issue for us (except I would not recommend the walk in high heels - ouch!) The rooms were clean and had great decor with a real Key West tropical feel. We were in a King Deluxe room and loved the small little patio with the blooming tree. My only complaint was the t.v. remote had some issues but who really stays in their hotel room long enough to watch a lot of t.v. when in Key West. I also wish there was more counter space in the bathroom for getting ready but the glass shelves above the toilet were helpful for holding the smaller stuff. The staff was very helful. They called cabs for us and held our luggage on the day we were to leave since we checked out at 11am and the boat did not leave until 5:30pm. I have read some complaints in the past and I have never seen any merritt to them. I've never experienced any of the issues that others have claimed. We will def come back again next year if not sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, Great time”
Reviews.Author: Plowboy29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. We had room #37 a king size bedroom by the pool. We absolutely loved it. Has the old style charm with many ammenities. Our room was very clean and comfortable with a small mini fridge and coffee pot. Easy walking distance to Duval street and the Southern Most bar. We visited both quite a bit. It was nice to have the free parking for our rental car. The continental breakfast was good and held us over until a late lunch each day. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. We will defintely stay here again, which I hope will be sooner than later. Larry and Diane

Reviews.Title: “Everything was awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cobias
Reviews.Content: We found the Key Lime on line and were so happy we chose it as our accomodations. Our room was small, but very cute and clean. Staff very friendly and attentive. We actually met 7 other couples by the pool and ended up having a great time with them. We were there to celebrate my 50th birthday and it couldn't have been better. Actually, we are planning to meet our new friends again next year at the Key Lime. They have been staying there for many years, so that says something in itself. Thanks so much for everything. Missing all the fun I had already!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing place to visit.”
Reviews.Author: PamEnglewood
Reviews.Content: Perfect location if your looking for peace and quiet, yet with just a short walk to Duval St. if your looking for night life.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: copwife77
Reviews.Content: I really loved the Key Lime Inn. The people there were so nice and helpful. If my husband and I ever get a chance to go back we would defiantly say there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn, great location, great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: mxp2000
Reviews.Content: We are very haooy about the experience in Key West. We stayed there only a night in August and it was not easy to find an accomodation because, even if there is a huge number of options, most of them require a minimum stay of 2 or even 3 nights and it was not our case. We booked a wonderful King Room with privae patio at the Key Lime Inn via Expedia and there was absolutely no problem. We arrived in Key West quite early (11 am) and even if the room was still not ready, the front desk Staff ask their colleagues to give priority and make it ready in the followinfg 15 minutes. We parked the car in their free parking lot and decided to go to eat something. In fact, when we came back, he room was ready for us! They assigned room 36, directly at the pool, in a wonderful position, which was also very quiet.
