The Inn is just a block from Duval Street and Mallory Square and 8-10 min walk from Most Southern Point. It is also closed (5 min walk) from Hemingway's house and from the Lighthouse. The Inn offers also a large breakfast at the pool but we did't try it as we were setting off very early for Sanibel. We defintely suggest to stay here if you happen to be in Key West! PS: don't forget to try the beach bucklet in mallory Square, a frozen big coctail served in Mallory Square! It is SUPERB!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room plus old town charm”
Reviews.Author: Travelers281
Reviews.Content: We paid for a deluxe queen room, which they upgraded to a king room (at no charge) when we arrived. The room was clean and well appointed, the staff was helpful, friendly and knowledgeable and the location worked well for us. Not a glamorous beach hotel, and not a gourmet breakfast, but it fit our needs well and we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Peaceful little Inn”
Reviews.Author: PalmTree767
Reviews.Content: This Inn turned out to be a good experience. My husband and I had never stayed at a bed and breakfast before. The front desk people were very friendly and always offering to help make my stay better. This spot is only two blocks from duval street and is close enough to access to but far enough to get that peaceful retreat you are looking for too! The parking in Key West is crazy, but this Inn has a free parking lot for their guests to use. The walk to duval street is only two blocks, but the walk to Mallory Square was about eight or nine blocks which was easy and required no transportation. Once we arrived at the Inn our car rental never left the parking lot. There is a CVS located across the street that has all your last minute or late night needs since they are open 24 hours. The pool area at the Inn is small, but it is quite relaxing and has plenty of lounge chairs and tables to read a book or to relax and take a nap. The continental breakfast in the morning isn't the best it could be. It toasts, muffins, danishes and bagels. Coffee and Orange juice as well. This was fine for my husband and I but if you were looking for a big hot breakfast then this would not be ideal for you. The only complaint I would have about this Inn, is the bed. The beds are horribly stiff. Be prepared to have an uncomfortable night sleep. The rooms are small, but they are clean. Overall, we had a nice, relaxing time and we would stay there again but be more prepared for the hard beds that await us.

Reviews.Title: “an adorable gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: amschmitt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a short visit to Key West, just 3 nights. This is a really cute place, very friendly service, in a pretty good location just a handful of blocks off Duval. It's a bit of a longer hike to get down to the end of Duval (Sunset Pier area), but not too bad. The pool area seemed small but nice. We didn't use it during our stay. Our room was simple and clean, plenty of space, and the whole property is just adorable. Quiet. The continental breakfast isn't fancy but certainly ample. We would definitely stay here again. In a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect fit for Key West”
Reviews.Author: Wickedmotion
Reviews.Content: This quaint inn is an excellent choice if you are looking for a nice place in the historic district. The cottages are small and maybe a bit un-impressive at first, but they are cozy and nice and really fit in with the entire ambiance of the Keys. Very convenient to Duvall Street with a great pool and a simple breakfast served poolside. For our first visit to the Keys we were very happy with this choice and would certainly return again. We travel frequently and average about 60 nights yearly in hotels and hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rulax1574
Reviews.Content: This place was average. It is very outdated. The rooms are very very small. The beds and bedding are terrible. No real amenities in the room. The TV didn't work, the AC unit looked like someone puked in it. The place smelled like pine scented chemicals. The breakfast was plain bagels and juice and coffee. I don't think a rooster at 3am making a racket is quaint. It's annoying. I have been to KW many times and this is my least favorite place. I'm not sure why all of these other people are writing glowing reviews,they must not have stayed in other places.

Reviews.Title: “We are coming back!”
Reviews.Author: PonchoDon47
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Key Lime Inn, during Meeting of the Minds this past year. When it came time to book accomodations for 2009, the wife said, "I want to stay at the Key Lime Inn again", which was fine with me. The location is very good, far enough off Duval to be quiet, but close enough to be convenient. A nice pool, decent continental breakfast, and all the staff were quite nice to us. Like many others, we parked our rental car and never drove it again, for the whole week, so this year, we are just flying into Key West and renting scooters or bicycles to do our running around. As the words to one of my favorite songs goes, "I Have Found Me a Home", whenever I'm in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Key Lime”
Reviews.Author: theworldfascinatesme
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Loved our little cottage and the great breakfast by the pool. Staff was so nice (like everyone else :)) and just made our stay in KW so relaxing and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Babyda
Reviews.Content: After a 7 hour drive from Clearwater, it was so pleasant to arrive here at Key Lime Inn with free parking. We are saying in a delux Queen room which is great. A Continental Breakfast is served at the pool deck between 8.30 and 10.30 a.m. each morning consisting of coffee, orange juice, a variety of breads including english muffins and bagels. The rye bread is delicious. Fresh fruit and yoghurt are also on offer. Pool is great. Nice and clean and not too busy. The plus here is that it caters for couples and there are no children. Such a relaxing place to stay here in Key West. Lots of good restaurants nearby to eat as the Inn is located only a couple of blocks away from Duval Street and the mandatory Malllory Square where to view the sunset from. Highly recommend Salsa Loca on Duval - best Mexican food and very reasonably priced. Waiting staff are friendly and efficient We hired bikes and managed to see Key West in less than a day. Recommend you visit the Little White House (where President Truman stayed) and Ernest Hemingway's house - for the cat lovers amongst you. If visiting Key West again, would stay here and have no hesitation in recommending it to friends and colleagues. Oh on a side note there is a resident Rooster - Bernard and his friends who likes to wake you up of a morning and strutt around the premises looking for a friendly crumb!! All in all a brilliant place to come and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Key Lime Inn was very nice!”
Reviews.Author: babie22559
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Key Lime Inn over the Valentineâ€™s weekend. The Inn is very nice with nicely landscaped grounds. We stayed in the #3 stand alone room that we affectionately referred to as â€œthe love shack.â€� At first glance, it looked like a shed, but we warmed up to it after just a few minutes inside. The room was clean, but the bed was a little stiff. There was also a cute patio outside. The Inn is very close to Duval Street. Itâ€™s an easy walk or very short scooter ride. The breakfast was just fine for us â€“ bagels, coffee, yogurt, English muffins. We read the reviews online, se we didnâ€™t have very high expectations for breakfast. The room was very pricy; not sure that we would stay there again because of the price. But all the Inns are comparable price in downtown Key West. The Inn is also across the street from Mary Immaculate Star of the Sea Catholic Church (Sunday Mass at 7:30, 9, and 10:30am). The bells in the morning are very loud (but nice and peaceful) and may wake you up. If the bells donâ€™t wake you up, the roosters will. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place.”
Reviews.Author: Leo35
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Key Lime Inn for 2 nights. We had to come to Key West for a funeral and found the Key Lime Inn to be centrally located within walking distance to just about everything. The room was not large, but it was adequate. Everything appeared to be clean and we had no problems with the hotel staff (they seemed pleasant enough). The pool was well maintained and the breakfast was normal "continental fare" (muffins, bagels, coffee). The bed was comfortable and all was quiet at night with the exception of a big rooster who decided to make a bit of noise from time to time (this is normal for Key West and something that you have to learn to live with). Overall, pleasant stay. I would have expected more for the price we paid (165.00/nt), but it was a clean, convenient place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Playswdogs
Reviews.Content: Good location, parking was very convenient. Location is walking distance from most attractons. Grounds and rooms were very clean. Bed was OK - but I agree with another review that it could be a lot better for the money. The hotel we moved onto (in another Key) was lessor quality with a much better bed. Breakfast was the typical hotel type. Bagels, muffins and coffee. Nothing special, but served nicely. Overall a good value, but we would probably take our chances on a new location for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Average for the price”
Reviews.Author: adman8961
Reviews.Content: A great location, close to Duval St. I never used the car the whole trip there, and the parking is free, which is nice. The staff is not over-friendly by any means. I was very disappointed by the breakfast too, I don't think bagels, muffins and coffee fall under the category of a bed and breakfast. Rooms were relatively clean, small and quaint. Nice having the "breakfast" on the deck by the pool in the morning too. I think I would try another place next time close to there.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marc19002
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year we have stayed at the Key Lime Inn. Both times we stayed in the Superior Queen Room. The staff were very friendly throughout our stay. We never ate at the continental breakfast so I can't comment on that aspect. Our only complaints were the temperature of the shower was hit or miss. Somedays, it was great, other days it was luke warm at best. It didn't seem to matter what time of day we used the shower either. We mentioned this to the desk staff twice and both times they said they would look into it the problem, but the problem persisted. The other complaint is the fridge isn't a real fridge, but a wine fridge so nothing in it gets really cold. The rooster...OK, he is retarded and really does start crowing at 3AM EVERY morning and randomly throughout the day as well. The location is great and the free parking is also a plus. Everything in Key West is expensive and overpriced and having stayed at many other locations in KW, I feel the Key Lime is a nice place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place”
Reviews.Author: tenhisslayer
Reviews.Content: Our last vacation we stayed at the Lighthouse Court which is a sister property of the Key Lime Inn. We loved that place also, so we were excited to try the Key Lime Inn. One thing that made us pick them this year was the availability of parking. That was great. We did not use our car really, but just being able to have it safe was great. The rooms are clean, we booked a King so we got a patio area. I found the staff to be very friendly. Now we have family in the area, so didnt really need advice on local attractions, but the desk clerks are very nice and friendly. The location is very convenient, located in the historic area of Key West. That is a must for us. The weather dipped a bit when we were there and the pool was heated. That was great. This place is great, we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: MikeMo8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend here and couldn't wait to leave. We are both in our early 30s and are used to staying at not-so-great places, but this place was $149 a night and we expected much more. The bed was lumpy and uncomfortable to the point where we were getting up early because our backs and necks hurt. We didn't care that the room was small, but we were very concerned for our security. Each cabana opens to the pool area, which anyone can walk into. The bolt lock couldn't be locked from the outside, so if you leave your room for the day or night, you can only lock the doorknob lock, which could easily be opened with a credit card (I did it). That would be alright if the safe worked in the room, but it was broken. We were afraid to leave anything in the room (laptop, Blackberry, etc.) The breakfast was way inferior to other B&B breakfasts I've had. It was basically some yogurt, coffee, and bagels and muffins. Again, not a huge issue if it wasn't for the $149 a night we were paying. The good things were the close proximity to Duval St., where you could find a place for a decent breakfast. Also, the pool was clean and well-maintained, and the rooms were clean as well. The roosters and chickens outside our door at 7:30am were pretty funny and part of the experience in Key West. All in all, it was a small, ok place, but definitely not worth the price we paid. We felt ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy chickens ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: Tim96141
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 or 9 nights in July 2008. I read many reviews on Trip Advisor before I booked, and while the reviews were not outstanding, I decided to give it a try. A couple of main reasons for choosing Key Lime Inn were that my friends were staying right next door at The Mermaid & The Alligator, the price was right, it has a good central location, and the pictures looked pretty good. I had a "superior queen" room which was fine. Pros on the room: It was clean, towels and sheets were good, the air conditioner worked really well, housekeeping service was good, shower was fine, cable TV included, overhead fan. It had a small wine refrigerator which wasn't too cold, but OK if you drank your beer fast. There was a loose tile on the bathroom floor and the floor grout was really dirty, except under the sink where no one walks. Breakfast was just OK. The pool is OK, but it's right on the highway which is a detractor. Otherwise, the stuff that was pretty negative was: Location, in that it is right on the highway and traffic (e.g. loud motorcycles, trucks) can be heard in the room. At the same time the location is good in that it is centrally located, it would be better if it were just a block off the highway. Last is the roosters, they started crowing at 3 AM everyday. That is really annoying. Aside from putting up fences to keep them out, I suppose there is nothing that can be done about them. However, my friends at the B&B next door never heard them their entire stay. Overall, my stay was fine, but I would not stay there again. I think you can spend a few more bucks and get a better place. I've attached a map of the Inn grounds that they gave me. If you decide to stay there, try to get a room off the highway and away from the parking lot. I was in #17. Other stuff: Go to Dry Tortugas, it's worth it. Have breakfast at Azur, it's 1,000 times better than Blue Heaven. Try Seven Fish, Sarabeth's and drink at the Conch Republic. Get a gyro at Miami Subs (yes, I know it's a chain). Rent Scooters at A&M right down the street from Key Lime Inn, great prices for a week rental. There's a CVS right down the street which is great for beer and supplies. Here's a Google maps link with the Inn marked: http://maps.google.com/maps/ms?ie=UTF8&hl=en&msa=0&ll=24.553466,-81.796024&spn=0.003508,0.006974&t=h&z=18&msid=108574064259844408996.0004583e9794ea6253ff7 Have fun...

Reviews.Title: “nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: talesfromthecrib
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were really satisfied with the location of the Key Lime Inn. It's very close to Duval Street and all other great locations of Key West. The rooms were okay and clean, the staff was friendly and we enjoyed the pool. Breakfast was nothing special, but okay. I would stay there again if we ever return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Stappers
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Key West without a hotel booking and saw the Key Lime Inn which looked really nice from the street. We checked in for 4 days but only stayed one of those. We were put in one of the outhouse buildings in the back of the property. These again were quite quaint looking and were next to the pool area. The pool area looked quite good and was a good size for the number of rooms with plenty of loungers. They sold cold drinks next to it aswell. If was only two minutes walk to Duval street with its bars and restatuants and a big plus was that there was plenty of parking at the hotel. It was also within walking distance to the public beach and the southernmost point. The rooms themselves were also a good size with everything you'd expect in them On the flip side though the hotel was quite expensive compared to other hotels including the one we moved to the next day (The Pier house). It seemed expensive for the quality of the room aswell. Unfortunately our rooms was in one of the outhouses which seemed quite flimsy and more like a shed. Also, the property generally didn't seem that clean from the room to the dog mess on our doorstep which was nice welcome gift! Although this was a nice looking hotel at first glance it didn't live up to expectations unfortunately. If there'd been room in the main building then we'd have been alot happier but being given a room on of the out buildings seemed overpriced for the quality you'd expect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: cab_xr3i
Reviews.Content: We spent an fantastic honeymoon for many reason, one of them was the Key Lime Inn. Without requesting, they gave us a private cottage just outside the hotel building and it was all so perfect. The hotel is just 2 blocks away from Duvall street and a parking spot is a headache, so the Key Lime's free parking for visitors was a bonus. The hotel was spotless clean and the continental breakfast by the pool was terrific. The secluded pool area sets the perfect atmosphere for one to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Inn”
Reviews.Author: dreamerzNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Key Lime Inn for 2 nights in May. It's a quaint KeyWest type Inn. The queen room was nice but small - but were really only there to sleep and rest our feet after seeing the sites. The bathroom was a little inconvenient. The shower was quite small and no place to put soaps/shampoo, etc. The roosters at 5 am added to the ambiance; just glad they weren't right outside our window. Would recommend the Key Lime Inn.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: jscottsix
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day stay at the Key Lime Inn and had a wonderful time!!! My husband and I had planned this trip with some of our closest friends (three other couples) and could not have been more pleased with our accomodations. Everything about the Inn was just as the website and other tripadvisor reviewers had promised. Our rooms (and bathrooms) were roomy and clean, with comfortable beds and lots of pillows. Each of our rooms had a lovely balconey and the pool area was nice and sunny with lots of tables and chairs. One of the best things about the Key Lime Inn is all the available onsite parking. Most places that close to downtown have terrible parking but it was such a breeze for us to park everyday. The staff at the Inn was wonderful (especially Richard) :) We were only two blocks from Duval Street so getting around was great. We also rented a 4-seater golf cart, which I highly recommend for ease of parking while shopping or going to the beach. Hint: Key West beaches are not that great, but be sure to check out Fort Zachary Taylor Beach....you won't be sorry! It's one of the islands best kept secrets! If you are looking for a great place to stay while visiting Key West, you won't find much nicer accomadations for the price. We were sad when our vacation came to an end but thrilled that we know exactly where we'll be staying the next time we are in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Rooster-roo”
Reviews.Author: Golden-mole
Reviews.Content: We had booked the hotel for 2 nights in a queen size 'country room'. The room was in a single storey 'cabin' in the grounds. Country-style is one description for the room. Don't expect a glamourous room. Historic meaning old, definitely. Rustic comes to mind. The room was small, not much bigger than the bed and the bathroom minute, it seemed be be 'tacked on' to the end of the room. The location is good, within easy walking distance of Duval St. However, there was one major problem. Chickens and roosters. These wandered loose in the grounds. Have you ever been woken by a rooster standing outside your door at 2 in the morning? And then at 3, and 4? Some might think it entertaining or an adventure, but it was a real pain. The owners who live in the main house said that they never notice the noise. Having been kept awake all night we decided to move out and find somewhere quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: JKGHfx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 08. Were required to pay for our five nights accommodation when we checked in! The accommodations were just OK - clean but warn and dated. Won't stay there again; there are nicer places for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay & roosters too”
Reviews.Author: GSDiva
Reviews.Content: Key Lime Inn was relaxing, perfect for a getaway. It was clsoe enough to the action (few blocks to Duval), but not loud. The pool is the best part, large, plenty of room and shaded under a canopy of palms. I could have stayed there all day. The rooms were smaller but similar to any beach hotel. Nice flat screen TV, toiletries were above average. They supplied beach towels. A/C worked well and was loud enough to drown out most of the crowing. Overall the Key Lime was quiet, roosters aside. They have a nice courtyard with swing. And there is free parking. The continental breakfast was pleasant, that is all I need. Coffee may have been strong for vacation but that is OK. PLeny of places to walk to, and a CVS across the street for snacks. The roosters & chickens..very entertaining to me. I do not recall that many roosters in KW before but they were hysterical. They crowed all day long, all night long and strutted around the pool. They appeared at my feet one AM. It really gave the inn a flavor. We named them and thought they were great. Yes, we'd go back, have great memories.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Stay”
Reviews.Author: ocaballero
Reviews.Content: I love Key West. I have stayed at about 15 different guesthouses as well and B&Bâ€™s. This time around I decided to stay at the Key Lime Inn to my surprise it was the worst experience ever. The property was beautiful to say the least until 5:30 AM when about 8 roosters decided to crow their way in to my sleep until 11:30 that I checked out. Since the property is open the local rooters could walk in as they please. Even though I love animals I must say that this was a big problem. No other place that I have staid in has ever had this issue. To be honest with you I walked over to Dennis that morning and asked for country chicken fried steak. I will never stay in this location no matter how wonderful the actual property was. I believe part of a vacation is sleeping in and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “What you go to Key West For!!”
Reviews.Author: up.hillKansasCity
Reviews.Content: This place is exactly what we go to Key West for. It's very charming and near enough to everything. The rooms are nothing special, but extremely clean! The staff is great, and they have free continental breakfast in this wonderful little courtyard area outside. It's just a great little place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful getaway”
Reviews.Author: mymainewoman
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Key Lime Inn over President's Weekend and had a lovely stay! Our room directly faced the pool and breakfast area (served outdoors on the pool terrace), but we were never disturbed by other guests. The room itself was clean, large and felt recently renovated. Though not the most centrally located hotel, we could easily walk down to Duval St. and most locations in downtown Key West. The continental breakfast was fine, and the front desk staff very helpful in suggesting restaurants for dinner. We'll definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: Basil007
Reviews.Content: The pros: great location, pretty decor, comfortable bed, nice linens, decent breakfast (included). And the roosters and chickens on the property added a fun "Key West touch" to the stay (but see the cons). On-site parking is free, but not guaranteed. The cons: a noisy, outdated air conditioner kept us awake at night. There was no alternative, as our "deluxe" room lacked a window, so we couldn't let in the breeze. Also, if you shut off the loud A/C, you're sure to hear the roosters crowing at 3 a.m. (so much for the "pro" above). We had double patio doors out to our private patio area, but there was no screen, so we couldn't leave the doors open all night (there are little critters, including the occasional scorpion, in Key West, folks). Also, only one-third of the patio was paved; the rest was full of dead leaves and stones (not very pretty). The bathroom fan was very noisy, and there was limited space for toiletries. Some of the staff were wonderful, a couple seemed very uncaring and distracted. Overall, I'd say it's a pretty enough place to stay, but the cons don't justify the rate of almost $300 per night. To be fair, Key West is not inexpensive, but I would look elsewhere if I ever return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Key Lime Inn!”
Reviews.Author: BeachGrlVa
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a three night stay at the Key Lime Inn. It was great! We had our own little cottage with a private deck (deluxe king suite), flat screen TV, fridge,sofa and coffeemaker. The room was really cute and cozy, the grounds are nice and the pool is good too. Everyone that worked there seemed helpful, and we felt like it was a great deal for the price. Our only complaint, which is a minor thing, is there was only one small soap dish in the shower. The owners could spend $2 on a shower caddy and make a lot of people happy to be able to get their shampoo etc up off of the floor! But really, if that is the worst thing about the room, I think they're doing something right. If you're looking for a "moderately" priced place to stay in Key West not far from the action on Duval St., this is it! We got married on the beach in KW and when we return to celebrate future anniversaries, we'll definitely stay at the Key Lime again.

Reviews.Title: “no amenities”
Reviews.Author: wildelms
Reviews.Content: first of all, one has to book a suite if one wants a tv or refridge in their rooms. who wants to go to the keys in the summer and have no refridge in the room? the people at the front desk are extremely rude and their attitude is, "what are you going to do, leave? you won't get a refund." too bad the previous owners of the chelsea sold out to these people.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: ccarusone1
Reviews.Content: Really like the Inn for the Cost. Stayed in our own little cottage that had a seperate patio. Pool was very clean and heated. Overall it was wonderful. Walked to Duval Street, Southern Most Point, and Mallory Square. Did have to rent scooter to go to Smathers Beach. If you are on a budget and want to stay somewhere decent this is the place to go. I would definently stay again. The only thing I miss is having a resturant to go to on site, but there are plenty of places to go within walking distance. Duval Street is only about 5 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: DJRitz
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Nice rooms with flat screen TVs. Tropical atmosphere. Continental breakfast outside by the pool. The staff was extremely nice. No problem with communication. Fairly close to Mallory Square. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Key Lime”
Reviews.Author: jenCALI
Reviews.Content: Beware....don't get the rooms by the street if you expect to get any sleep. I booked months in advanced for a standard room and was very dissappointed that I got the room that was facing the parking lot and closest to truman ave (hwy 1). It was extremely loud here! When I asked for another room the front desk guy said that they were all booked and that there was nothing they could do. The next day I saw people checking out and asked if I can get one of their rooms and if he can put somebody just checking in into the room I had. He said no. Another problem we had was with the pool. It was extremely cold. When we told the front desk clerk he said he would turn on the heater. The next day the water was still cold. Again the front desk guy said that the heater takes 3 days to work. huh??! So we finally asked him if we can go to one of the other properties and he said yes. Right next door at the chelsea house(i think) we went in there pool and it was much better. ALSO, the room we had was TINY. We were only able to bring in one suitcase. The others we had to leave in the car. There was also no counter space and the shower curtain in the bathroom was about 4 inches to short on width so water fell onto the bathroom tile. Overall, I probably wouldn't stay here again. If I did, I would definitely spring for the upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay............”
Reviews.Author: jandc_7
Reviews.Content: This charming historic guesthouse is well located on Truman Ave and just a short 10mins walk to Duval Street. We stayed four nights in a standard room (No.26), simply furnished but spacious and comfortable if a little dated. Modern touches such as flat screen TV complement the historic ambiance of this traditional guesthouse. The small pool is adequate for cooling down but not really swimming. Breakfast served poolside is a nice touch - as are the family of chooks that frequent the grounds! We noticed some noise from the incoming aircraft arriving at EYW but then there are only a handful of flights a day. Friendly staff, value for money and good location make this an above average choice. J&C South London (UK)

Reviews.Title: “Great place, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: tom42n
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night stay and found the Key Lime Inn to be just want we wanted....perfectly located, not too close to the Duval noise but within a short walk of all of the action. The property was very clean with excellent good sized rooms and the pool and breakfast were just right. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: ColeinCO
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice, clean little getaway for a girls only weekend and we found it! The Key Lime Inn fit the bill perfectly! We were there during Bike Week, and wanted to be close to Duvall, yet far enough away from the noise. The Key Lime was the perfect distance to everything. We didn't use our car once! The pool was fantastic and relaxing - perfect! The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was very clean. We booked very last minute (a cancellation is the only reason they had a room available) and I requested a room near the pool and they were actually able to accomodate my request! We couldn't have been more happy!

Reviews.Title: “Key Lime - simply Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Denise1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the same time as the last reviewer and met the rooster with a broken watch. Luckily for us, he was happy to wander round us at the pool area, we didn't get bothered by him in the early hours. The Key Lime Inn is a little oasis of calm, just a couple of blocks away from lively Duval Street. You have the best of both worlds.... near everything Key West has to offer, and when you are weary of the sight-seeing, the swiming pool is quiet and refreshing, shade offered by the beautiful palm trees. Didn't sample the continental breakfast, being English, we couldn't resist the Denny's about 2 mins walk away (we don't have them at home). Our room was a King size deluxe with an absolutely huge bed. The fridge was amazing, we experienced an exploding can of coke it was that cold. The gardens are beautifully kept, lots of little nooks and crannies, hammock swing, gecko's.... the rest of our trip to Miami and the Keys was in large Marriott hotels, which were lovely, however, my partner and I both agree that we will definately used the Key Lime as our base for our next visit to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bluewater
Reviews.Content: We only live an hour away from Key West, but needed to stay the night for an event. We stayed at the Key Lime Inn last year and were happy to go back. This year we were upgraded to a wonderful room. It's not a fancy place, but it is very clean, bright and comfortable. If you are looking for a fancy room like the Hyatt or similar have, this is not for you. If you are looking for a nice place that's clean, then this is for you. The continental breakfast was all we needed to get our day started. Coffee, OJ, bagels, muffins and yogurt are the staples. My only complaint is the rooster that doesn't know how to tell time. He sat at our door and crowed and screamed, starting at 3am. He was close to being on the breakfast table. Other than that, I highly recommend the Key Lime Inn. Great location, quick walk to Duval, quiet besides the rooster.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing.....”
Reviews.Author: LCandSC
Reviews.Content: Had a relaxing stay here in May. Great place but not cheap. We stayed in a Superior Queen room. Loved the way the place was set out and the â€˜luggage cartsâ€™ Breakfast was great sitting around the pool area. Towels were left in the rooms for the pool. The big disappointment was the lack of chickens!!! No problems at all with any crowing and we had set our hearts on hearing them!! Would definitely recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Postaljames
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 wonderful, relaxing days @ Our Home in Paradise. The very accomidating staff allowed us to view different suites and make our choice. I was registered at a convention in another nearby hotel, but chose to stay again at the Key Lime Inn. Whether in our charming, clean room or lounging poolside our stay was 1st Class. The FREE WI-FI was a plus. We will be back, again and again, God willing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Go_Ravens22
Reviews.Content: We stayed there w/ 2 other couples during July--very hot out! We stayed in #36, a deluxe bedroom which was perfect for us! We literally stepped outside to the pool. We loved it & plan on staying there again next time we visit. The room was clean (keep in mind it is not a new hotel), we had plenty of towels delivered to us each morning, we had a mini-fridge in the bathroom, nice bath amenities (even though I always bring my own to supplement), & a decent continental breakfast. (muffins, pastries, bagels, English muffins, yogurt, apples, OJ & really good coffee, as well as jellies, butter, cream cheese...) We only ate there once & decided to check out other area restaurants, including Blue Heaven. It is a little walk to Duval St., not bad, just make sure you are ready to walk! Don't come here w/too high expectations thinking that everything should be like it is at a big chain hotel--it is not--it is a part of the Key West old town experience, though. I thought is was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “perfect place, very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: rayebaltimore
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed there for three nights and thought it was perfect. We had our own little bungaloo that had an outside seating area as well. Accomodations were nice as well. There is a pool and breakfast is served by the pool.Although it was about a 5-10 minute walk to some places it was perfect to be aware from all of the hussle and bussle and parking was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely! Just what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: StephArden
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, casual little Inn in a historic area, very close to Duval (within walking distance). We loved it! The room in our little cottage was lovely and comfortable, with a nice little bathroom with a huge shower, spa quality toiletries, plantation shutters, a ceiling fan and a very comfortable bed and lots of pillows. The pool was clean, warm and pleasant, and we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and feeding the rooster! I wanted to be awakened by the roosters, but never did hear him! Loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gambler777
Reviews.Content: We were just at the key lime inn last week for 4 days in May, I did alot of reading of reviews on trip advisor, and boy did it work out well !!, first the key lime inn was great, and the staff was also great, we had no problems at all while we were there, and the chickens were not a problem at all, we did not here them enough to keep us up. the rooms were alittle small but very clean, we stayed in #17 and it was well worth the money. the breakfast they put out at 8am was quite good, they had all that one would need to get the day started.. overall we will for sures return to the key lime inn again when we go back to key west.

Reviews.Title: “The Key Lime Inn is a great anniversary spot.”
Reviews.Author: Nanaof2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Key Lime Inn B & B May 4, 2007-May 6, 2007 we went for our 30th wedding anniversary. We both loved it, the room (we had the deluxe king) was on the second floor with a porch overlooking Truman Ave. The bells from the church across the street added charm to the B&B. as did the roosters that roamed outside. We were very pleased with the cleanliness of the room, the bathroom, the gardens and pool (with separate pool towels in our room that were huge) which we used each night. The continential breakfast consisting of bagels, muffins, a variety of bread for toasting, fruit, yogurt, orange juice and both regular and decafe coffee was outstanding. The office staff were more than eager to help me with directions and marking maps for the "tourist" spots and The Old Town Trolley. My husband and I walked to Duval St. and Mallory Square we enjoyed the scenery and didn't think it was too long of a walk. We plan on staying at the Key Lime Inn on our next visit and took enough Key Lime Inn cards to pass out to our family and friends. Thanks to all the staff for making our visit so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice B&B”
Reviews.Author: WPALovethesun
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice B&B. We stayed in a seperate one room cottage with beautiful hard wood floors, high ceilings, and a plasma TV on the wall. Our stay was very enjoyable. The pool is very nice, many chaise lounges and tables. The breakfast each morning consisted of pastries and bagels that you could toast. We also had a frig in our room which was convenient for pop, beer or leftovers. I can't say that the staff was overly friendly or helpful, just adequate. The only down side we found was the distance to Duval Street. We had to walk 3 blocks to Duval, and then many many blocks (maybe 8) to the end of Duval street and the ocean views. I would probably look for a hotel or B & B closer to all the shops and restaurants if we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Lucked out on everything”
Reviews.Author: Phillygirl913
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days and 3 nights in Key West at the Key Lime Inn. What a great experience. We had a deluxe king room #36 right off the pool. The room had everything we needed. Loved being close to the pool. The roster and his hen added to the "away" feel of the Inn. The continental breakfast was very good, just enough to get your day started. We walked everywhere, that's how close you were to the Duval Street activities. There was never a problem with noise from anyone or anything. The room was always clean when we returned from sightseeing. The staff were very helpful and there was more than enough information available so that you knew where to go and what to do. Enjoyed relaxing afternoons by the pool. It was never crowded and there were always lounges available. We will definitely go back to the Key Lime Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint cottage!”
Reviews.Author: jesinjax
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Key Lime Inn and had a wonderful time. PROS: Pool with poolside hammock, private bungalow room that had excellent A/C. Great location, a CVS drugstore is across the street and Duval is a few blocks away. CONS: The parking situation is not good, the lot fills up fast! And, the roosters that roam the property can wake you up early with their crowing!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyDeere
Reviews.Content: Staff was not friendly at check in. We told them we were checking out one day early so the room could be rented. Staff said ok. When we checked out, different staff seem suprised that we were leaving early and were quite independent. We got no "thank you" for staying with them. Bathroom door hinges were so rusty it was hard to swing. No stopper in sink. Only two thin towels supplied and one bar of soap to be alternated between shower and sink??? for $229.00 a night, I expected more. Roosters crow at 3AM which is not hotel's fault. Other than that, fairly good location and was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: miloNewcastel
Reviews.Content: date.16th feb.07. Reviewer.Newcastle. England. Stayed for 3 nights. at a cost of 840 us$.(not cheap ) No tea/coffee making facilities.No fridge.and NO SLEEP. We went to the keys to sample the peace and tranquility,and relax for the week.We chose the Key Lime as it was far enough away from Duval street to escape the noise, but close enough to walk there. On arrival we went to our hut.(no 25). upon entering we were greeted with a very distinct smell of dampness, the room was clean in appearance but very small. when we contacted reception re the lack of facilities we were informed that they were only provided for the larger more expensive suites.Upon check in we were aware of some chickens./cockerels on the premises( warning bells) but thought well we want to be up early anyway. We were up early .first night.0130hrs. 2nd night 2345hrs. 3rd night 0200hrs. and it wasn't just now and then, that they were cock-a-doodling!! it was continious all night ,even with ear plugs it was torture. On the first morning of no sleep i complained to reception, they just laughed and said they are protected on the island, you'll get used to them.(in 3 days??)...To sum up, only stay here if the following apply. 1) you like noisey chickens.2) you dislike sleep 3)You have impaired hearing.4) your sense of smell is impaired....oh and if you do get a similar room to ours, don't take your cat cos you wont be able to swing it.

Reviews.Title: “Only Good Things to Say!”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeGirlChicago
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Key Lime Inn for three of the five nights we were in Key West, the week before Christmas. The staff was very helpful from the moment we arrived. The two employees that worked at the front desk offered plenty of advice, recommendations and tips for our stay, as we had never been to Key West before. Our room was directly off the pool deck and right in front of where breakfast was served each morning. Despite having numerous people literally feet from our front door eating breakfast each morning, we never had a noise issue or saw any trace of food remnants once it was finished. The staff was very quick to clean up everything right away. Yes, the roosters were a bit of an annoyance on one occassion, but that's simply part of the island. Unless you are staying at a large hotel, on one of the higher floors, there's really little way around them. I know, I checked. Our room was simple, but kept very clean by the staff members. The pool was lovely, with several lounge chairs. While it does back up right to Truman street, the pool is raised several feet above street level, with a lovely fence and trees, bushes, etc. to block out the direct view from anyone on the street. The inn's location is great, as well. I highly advise anyone staying on the island to rent a bicycle, as cars are simply not necessary. The inn is a few minute bike ride to Duval St., which is one of the main attractions of the island. It might be a bit far of a walk later at night, but you certainly are kept a good distance away from the noise of the nightlife that runs up and down parts of Duval St. Overall, we absolutely loved our stay at the Key Lime Inn. All things considered, we'd stay there again in a heartbeat - and plan on it next year.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the shack from hell”
Reviews.Author: J&JLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights (Feb 1-3) while in Key West for the first time. We hated it. We booked a deluxe room and received a tool shed 25 feet from the main thoroughfare. It looked like an aluminum tool shed from Home Depot from the outside and was facing the parking lot. It had a double bed which sagged in the middle and a small bathroom with a toilet & shower. The sink was in the "main" room 2 ft from the bed. The bed gave us the "itchies". A single male friend also stayed there in a much nicer room with a king bed, couch & coffee table for the same price of $230. Somehow, we (newlywed couple) ended up in a shack with a tiny bed. At least there weren't any shared walls! There are roosters on the property who crow at the crack of dawn and the revving sound of the Harley Davidson's cruising down the street 25 feet away kept us up all night long. As for the pool area, while nice, it is far from peaceful as it abuts Truman (main road). The constant car & motorcycle noise and exhaust made it difficult for us to remain there. After 10 minutes I opted to return to our shed. We never had the breakfast as it started at 8:30am and given that we were up hours earlier (thanks to the roosters & Harleys), we were long gone from the property. We do not recommend this place if you are expecting a quaint B & B as the combination of noise, location and accommodations did not live up to our expectations and prior reviews. Get a place along Simonton or off Truman and you will do infinitely better.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy with little sense of Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Mirth60
Reviews.Content: We booked a "deluxe" king room for 3 nights the end of January. The room was on the second floor of a larger building, sharing a balcony with the room next door. We could hear the noise of the parking lot and US 1 most of the night. The windows were only covered with half of a white curtain set (no shades). However, the material didn't cover the entire window and we were constantly adjusting, trying to get some privacy and shut out some of the parking/road light. When we tried to have coffee on the balcony the next morning, the couple in the room next door was in plain sight. Needless to say, we moved back into our room. I asked to be placed in another room for the rest of our stay, I was rudely told that "simply" wasn't possible. The bathroom had one glass shelf that was bent and hanging down over the sink. So all our personal items had to be stored on the floor. They really need somewhere to place bathroom items. The 2 towels were cheap and thread-bare. They did provide 2 additional "spa/pool" towels that we used for bathing. The breakfast of frozen bagels, apples, (really bad) coffee and juice was served by the pool, but not available until 8:30. The pool was a wonderful setting, except when the weather turned cold. But the inadequate/cold breakfast gave us an excuse to go to Blue Heaven and Pepe's for fantastic meals! Parking was on a first-come basis and there were not enough spots for all the guests. So when we went to Pine Key for the day, we were unable to find parking when we returned at 4pm. I was impressed with the cleanliness of the room and the comfort of the bed. The room also had a small table with two rattan chairs, a painted table for coffee, 2 bed-side tables, and a 3 drawer rattan dresser. We won't stay here again. For $233 a night, I expected more and have received more at other Key West places.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Oregonians
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect when we booked the Key Lime Inn, since we'd never been to Key West before, but after reading reviews on Trip Advisor, we felt that we had made a good choice. And, we had! The inn (which happened to be the 1st motel in Key West) put us into a cottage room. It was newly remodeled and modern, with a flat screen TV, a small patio with table and chairs, and included a free continental breakfast by the pool. The inn was right on Hwy. 1, and was only a couple of blocks from Duval St. (the main shopping/eating street), so was very convenient. (Catholic Church right across street, too.) Appreciated having an iron and ironing board, and safe in the room. The staff was very prompt when we asked for additional pillows. We would definitely stay there again, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Pam & Dick, Massachusetts”
Reviews.Author: amyabby
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a FABULOUS trip to Key West. We spent our 6 night stay at the Key Lime Inn on Truman Avenue. The staff was friendly, very accommodating, and helpful. Our room was cheerful, bright, a good size, and right off the deck to the pool. The pool was a good size and the pool area was very comfortable. The pool was situated in the front and the cluster of rooms were located behind it to give the feeling of being in your own little world. On site parking was a hugh plus to us. The location was great, not far from Duval Street. The complimentary breakfast every morning between 8:30-10:30 was certainly sufficient. It consisted of muffins, bagel, english muffins, danish, yogurt, coffee and orange juice. Yes the roosters are around and they do "cock-a-doodle-do," but it wasn't every morning that we heard them. They are all over Key West, on Duval Street, in Mallory Square, everywhere. So if you don't want the roosters, then you don't belong in Key West. Would we go back to Key West....in a moment's notice. Would we stay at the Key Lime Inn again.....in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely recomendable”
Reviews.Author: Gloria77
Reviews.Content: Lovely place in Key West. We stayed here 2 nights in August 2006 during a Florida round trip. We could park our car on the properties parking ground. That was a big plus. We had a spacious clean room in the large building. The room had a big terrace where we could sit at night and enjoy a cold beer. The breakfast was very good. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sbgKentucky
Reviews.Content: The location was great , reasonable rates, rooms and pool were lovely, and it was quite. We walked everywhere we wanted to go - we will stay there again on the next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Hugely over-rated”
Reviews.Author: JCannuck
Reviews.Content: OK - picked this place based on location and great reviews. It was really very mediocre. Positives: 1) Location 2) Cute on the outside and nice pool & courtyard Negatives: 1) Service was scant and indifferent - very "institutional" and not "inn-like" at all. Have had better service in Super 8 or Econolodge 2) Room was moldy/dank. No visible dirt or mold. Room was soooo bare bones - uncomfortable bed, cheap linens and pillows, cheap, thin towels. 3) the roosters started crowing outside our door at 3AM!!! and never shut up. Bring ear plugs. 4) Breakfast was horrible: terrible coffee, wonderbread, store-bought pastries, apples (no bananas or oranges), no peanut butter----totally bare bones. We ditched it and went out for a nice breaky instead. Again, I've had better at road-side chain motels. I expect more from an historic inn. Basically, save your $$ and stay at a local chain hotel on the outskirts. Our hotel (Park Central) in Miami Beach was cheaper and FAR, FAR better w.r.t. the details that matter.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: leahandglen
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyf stayed here for one night in sep. It was absolutely lovely. The location is great walking distance from all the attractions. the hotel is very clean and the style fits right into key west. you feel like you have gone back in time!! the rooms are small but have everything you need. the pool was nice if a bit on the small side, breakfast is served by the pool and is nice. It is a buffet style breakfast which consists of coffee bagels and pastries. The car park is also a plus. overall a great place to stay I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: florida3122
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend here in September which I was nervous about because of hurricane season but the weather was great. When we got there check in was easy. We went to our room which is so charming and clean. The only problem was the door wouldnt close so we called the front desk and the sent someone right out and fixed it. The room was so nice it had a plasma tv, nice bed, closet,table and chair, mini fridge. The breakfast in the morning we only went to once since it was kind of late but it was just average because it was just danishes so not that filling. The pool is very nice and clean. The area around is very nice with the hammocks and flowers. There are roosters there but they are everywhere in key west so get used to it. Another nice thing is they had a parking lot, granted some people parked crooked which made it hard for everyone to park but after you park you wont need to drive again because Duval st. is a short walk and you can be at mallory sq. in 15 min. This place was wonderful and I would definitely go back. Oh and whatever you do dont eat at Duffy's right across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LeonardoMaggiore
Reviews.Content: Great resort in wonderful and romantic place. Original rooms old style but very comfortable. Nice breakfast poolside. But no staff nowhere ! Front desk warmless, don't carry about customers: help yourself for all !

Reviews.Title: “Too Cute!”
Reviews.Author: rojo35
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly pleased at this historic inn a few blocks from the famous Duval Street. We were lucky enough to be given a one-room cottage away from the pool and it's like it is your own little house! Breakfast was good and the roosters did crow a little in the morning. Because Key West is a tropical area, there were a few bugs that crept in--nothing too crazy though. If there are any Billy Corgan fans, this inn is right across the street from St. Mary Star of the Sea Church (the inspiration for the Zwan album). Very cute, clean, and great price!

Reviews.Title: “tropical paradise”
Reviews.Author: journeygrl
Reviews.Content: thanks to trip advisor we found Key Lime Inn... even thou i live in Florida i had not been to the KW since grade school. we booked our rooms in Key Lime Inn and headed down on a Friday. Both my girlfriend and I have very stressful jobs, so, to be able to get away to a place where we had no plans was a wonderful thought. we pulled up to the Key Lime Inn and i was in love right away. the parking area was surronded by little bungalows, a house turned into units, and this beautiful lush vegitation. we check in and head to our room which was one of the rooms in the large house. it was perfect,a smallish space but perfect since we planned on spending little time in the room. the best best part was a front door which lead to a gravel patio area which was surronded by the same beautiful vegitation. it was the picture of peace for us and exactly what we needed for our trip. the grounds were wonderful in a upscale camp kind of way with the different cabins and whatnot. the pool area was a quiet oasis. this is not a place you go to party like a rock star, the exact opposite, this is where you come to quiet your mind from reality. our rooms were cleaned daily, clean towels laid on the bed, bed maid and delicious shampoo, conditoner, shower gel and lotion were provided daily. that in itself was so decadent. we have two 9 month old puppies and this was the first time we have left them. i had seperation anxiety however, the momma chicken and her baby chicks helped ease that void. we took tons and tons of pictures just of the family alone! just like the previous reviewer, the fridge is wonderful as well as the CVS down the road. stock up on whatever beverages and snacks you may need. our only complaints were minor, we had a canopy bed, which each time we moved would squeak and creek, the bed and tv layout were such that the bed was always hindering the view of the TV (not that we were there to watch TV), hot water was sometimes hard to get, the rooster which woke us up daily was kind of annoying (however that is a part of KW living). again, as i said this are such stupid, minor things. overall, all small issues aside, i adored our trip to the KYI more than any trip i have been on in 2 years. we enjoyed the peace and beauty that KLI had to offer. as mentioned, our jobs are stressful and i am a typical corporate type who is always stressed, however when i walked in today my staff was amazed at how relaxed and happy i looked and the perma-smile on my face. we will go to KLI whenever we get the chance to vist KW again. I recomend it to anyone who are seaking refuge from the day to day grind. thanks to trip advisor and KLI for giving us the much needed break we needed. please go there should you need to ground yourself!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The only place we'll stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: beachbug308
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Key Lime Inn from 7/24/06-7/27/06 and absolutely loved everything about it. It was our first trip to Key West and the location was perfect for us. While it's true you can walk just about anywhere, it was VERY hot, being the end of July, so we rented a scooter and took that all over town. Parking was perfect at the KLI, we kept our rental car parked the entire stay and even had a spot for our rented scooter. We stayed in room 36, right by the pool. Other reviewers mentioned noise in the morning for the rooms by the pool during breakfast but my husband and I were already awake so it never bothered us at all. We can sleep through most anything anyway. We loved that you could take five steps from our room and be in the pool. We will definitely reserve the same exact room for our next trip. It was an adorable little cottage with a large bedroom and a well-appointed bathroom. The room was very clean and the maid staff kept it well-maintained. Breakfast was a plus too and it was nice to eat by the pool every morning. I actually have an aversion to birds but I ended up falling in love with a chicken and her chicks and I fed them popcorn every morning and afternoon. By the end of the trip, the chicken family would come looking for me! We loved the pool and since it was so warm we spent tons of time there during the warmest part of the day. A helpful hint- there's a CVS right up the street, which is handy for snacks and drinks. We bought a case of water and kept it in our fridge the whole time. There's nothing negative to say about the KLI, it was absolutely everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: beth e
Reviews.Content: This place was clean, comfortable, and located in a perfect spot. It was only a couple of blocks away from the action on Duval St, enough to not be rudely awakened by the same. There's a perfect breakfast spot with a cute seahorse on the door about a 3 minute walk away. I didn't have to use my car once while I was there. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place.”
Reviews.Author: DocBond
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Key West, my girlfriend and I stayed here the last week of June 2006; and we were definitely pleased. To be 3 or 4 streets up from where all the action is (Duvall St.), Key Lime Inn was very quiet and peaceful at night. The pool area was well kept and hardly ever crowded. The free continental breakfast, served from 8:30 â€“ 10:30, was perfect to jumpstart our day of exploring the island. Free parking is hard to come by on the island, so we just parked at the Inn and walked the whole time. Our first night in Key West we walked to both ends to Duvall Street in no time at all. We stayed in the basic one bedroom with one bathroom, which ran us $140 bucks (tax included). It was perfect. All the reviews I read said stay on this side of the island, and they were correct. I constantly used this site to research our vacation, so I felt had to contribute. What a great site.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: 3hall
Reviews.Content: The Key Lime Inn is a great place for anyone who is not looking for all the added frills, ammenities (and expenses) of a resort property. Great location, within walking distance to everything. Rooms are very nice. And we loved watching the mother hen and her chicks who were roaming the grounds -- so Key West! The Key Lime Inn is a terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Key Lime Inn”
Reviews.Author: Islandgirl1234
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Key Lime Inn 4 nights. July 3 - July 7. We were originally only going to stay 2 nights, but weren't on a tight schedule, so stayed 2 additional nights. It's very quaint, clean, and the location is great! Only a 2-3 block walk to Duvall Street where everything seems to be happening. They serve a nice continental breakfast poolside each morning. The girl at the desk gave us a great recommendation for Cuban food. the El Siboney - only a couple of blocks from the Inn. Great pool too! Only regret is that we were there in the middle of summer. We definitely want to return, but next time we'll go in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Key Lime Inn is Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: cmbmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Key Lime Inn this past week. We made our decision after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and it really paid off for us. The inn is not upscale, but very tidy and the grounds are lovely. Flowers are beautiful. We stayed in a deluxe king room (Number 5) and it was nice. The quality of the room rated 2.5 stars, but don't let that bother you. I am very picky about accommodations and was completely comfortable here. We were initially concerned because the room was in the small building with three other rooms. Our worries were put to rest when we got in the room. There were french doors leading out to a completely fenced in private patio with two chairs and a small table. Apparently, the cute little cottage type rooms that surround the pool don't have the private patio. That is what we were told. The beds were very clean and the housekeeping staff did an amazing job every single day. The location of the inn is on Truman, across the street from a beautiful old Catholic church and minutes from the popular and very busy Duval street downtown. Incredibly convenient location. We walked or rode our bikes everywhere, except when we drove to the boat to go SCUBA diving or when we drove to the airport to take a seaplane to the Dry Tortugas (which was worth every penny and the highlight of our trip!!!). Parking was a breeze at the Key Lime Inn. We always got a spot in the inn's lot. Parking can be a pain in Key West, because many accommodations do not have onsight parking. Why the "above average" instead of "excellent" review? Well, two small reasons. The first is that while the staff in the office were efficient, they were less than welcoming. Not rude, but far from friendly to us. Secondly, the desk called us twice to park our vehicle "better." We saw absolutely nothing wrong with our parking. We parked straight in the unmarked slots and courteously left room for other cars. We moved the car both times, but firmly decided that if asked again, we wouldn't be happy. These were two small complaints and did not put a damper on the stay. We were able to blow these minor things off and move on. The price of the Key Lime Inn is great for what you get. Truly a bargain. Simple, clean and relaxing atmosphere. We would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Stay at Key Lime Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Waht a nice stay we had at the Key Lime Inn. We chose a location closer in to the main activities of Key West and the Sight Seeing Trolley line - and this place worked perfectly. Nice pool and room was clean - tho small. Our room was right off the pool which made it nice as well. Continental Breakfast didn't start until 8:30 AM so we missed it on our departure day. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Monkeyno9
Reviews.Content: We had a poolside room (no 35) and if you've been back and read previous reviews I can confirm this is NOT a noisy room even though it's right by the pool and breakfast area,and you have private seats and a table. I don't have any basis for comparison but the KLI is clean, quiet, nice rooms, about 20 mins walk from Mallory Square, we had no problems parking and didn't move the car once because everything is within walking distance. I thought the pool was tiny but there's more to do in key west than swim in the hotel pool. With the massive choice of hotels in key west, KLI is a safe choice, not exceptional but very comfortable. I wouldn't rave about it, but I was very happy with everything.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Shine527
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint Inn with a great staff. This was our third stay at the Key Lime Inn and each time has been perfect. If you are looking for the big luxury hotels this is not the one. The rooms are nice and tidy yet are a bit small for people who plan to spend most of their time in them. And who wants to do that in paradise? The pool is wonderful. Always a nice place to sun and cool off during the hot day. The inn's atmosphere is laid back with a personal touch that doesn't leave you feeling they are in your space. The complimentary breakfast is just right for starting off your day; muffins, bagels, fruit, yogurt, coffee, juice, etc. You can enjoy it poolside among the palms and tropical plants. As I said this is our 3rd stay with them and it is the only place I will make our reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: maggs01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Key Lime Inn from 21st April - Originally planned to stay 3 nights but kept adding additional nights - Staff were friendly and very helpful. Booked a superior queen, was small but expected this from previous posts. However was spotlessly clean and the maid service did a great job, even got clean sheets half way through the stay. Small fridge which was a little noisy along with the A/C (but arenâ€™t they all)?? Nice continental breakfast, plenty of fresh muffins, bagels various breads, jams, cream cheese and good coffee and juice and large toaster. You hear some negative things about the breakfast on these posts, but not everyone wants to go to blue heaven every morning. Breakfast round the pool area was a nice way to start the day. Small but more than adequate pool area â€“ water was always perfect. Intentional or not I am not sure?? but free wireless access available round the pool. Keep and eye out for the resident hen and baby chicks. All in all a very nice â€“ would stay again, great value in comparison to some other hotels in KW Whilst your in KW you got to try : Seven Fish, 2 min walk from hotel. Sebago snorkel trips â€“ excellent value, great staff and seem to carry less passengers than some of the other outfits. Fort Zachary state park and beach. Irish Kevins. Conch Republic seafood restaurant bar.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you're looking for”
Reviews.Author: Krista_E
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a plcae that has Key West's special charm this is a great choice. The grounds and buildings are incredibly picturesque, and the chickens running about give it a bit of local color. The pool is very pretty and good enough sized, with palm trees for shade and comfortable lounge chairs. Our room (#11) was a deluxe king, in the 2-story house. I would have preferred a cottage after I saw how cute they were, but didn't ask to change and really ours was fine. A bit musty, but I don't know that I have ever had a Florida hotel room that wasn't. The bath had no tub, which wasn't a problem for us but might be to others. Location is fantastic -- close to everything, and far enough off the Duval strip to be quiet. We walked everywhere -- never moved the car once (though we were glad tohave free parking). Some here have noted that the walk to Mallory Square, etc. is a bit of a hike -- but it's really about 15 minutes, and we appreciated the walking as we ate more than our share of excellent food during the stay. Seven Fish is a particularly good restaurant just around the corner (you'll need a reservation). Breakfast was fine but basic, and only served 8:30 to 10:30 (an issue if you're catching an early-morning boat, etc.). All in all, just lovely. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, Great room, Great time”
Reviews.Author: Archerj2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stood at the Key Lime Inn from April 3rd Through the 10th. The room was very clean and good sized with vaulted ceilings (#36). The staff was friendly and helpful. The location (about two blocks off of Duval street) was perfect. We rented bikes for the week and had no problems getting anywhere. It was about a five minute bike ride to the beaches and I am happy we stood at an Inn and not a beachfront resort. It seems that the beaches have many overnight tenants. Sorry I digressed. The key lime inn is great, the grounds are well manicured and the pool is cozy. The continental breakfast was good but "Blue Heaven" is the place you want to go for breakfast. I would like to thank person who wrote the review for the Key lime Inn and suggested the "Sunset Wine Cruise" on "Danger Cruises" it was the highlight of our trip. We look forward to staying here again when we rerturn to the keys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Key Lime Inn at the end of April and it was very good. Very clean, nice sized rooms, staff were nice, breakfast round the pool was ok but nothing to write home about. It's just enough walk away from the noise of Duval Street but close enough to walk. Looking at other hotels / inns in Key West I think this is one of the better ones to go for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: TJR_Virginia
Reviews.Content: We just got back and spent 4 nights at the Key Lime. We were expecting a cottage because we booked a King Deluxe, but we were in the main house and our room was big and very nice. We had a huge balcony, a very comfortable bed, a large, clean bathroom with plenty of extra towels, flat screen TV, a great (but small) pool and the grounds were great! We thought this was a great place for the price and will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: gostling
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay in Key West for 3 nights. We wanted somewhere we could relax a bit while also providing a quiet but convenient base for enjoying all the island has to offer. This turned out to be exactly what we got. The room we had was described as a Superior Queen Room. This was quite small but spotlessly clean and nicely appointed including a small refridgerator. The aircon worked well and the LCD TV on the wall had good reception on most channels. The area around the pool has many chairs, tables and sun loungers available to guests and we found it a very pleasant place to spend a few relaxed hours. A very good continental breakfast is also served by the pool although this is not available until 8:30. The location is a about 5 minutes walk from the quiet end of Duval Street. It takes about 30 minutes to walk down to Mallory Square. The hotel has off-street parking but this is limited and is available on a "first come, first served basis". However with the convenient location of the Hotel we only took the car out once while we were there. We really enjoyed our stay here and found it to offer good value for money in really relaxed surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Key Lime is Average - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: STLTwin
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Key West and did some research on where to stay. We landed on the Key Lime Inn because of it's location, parking option, and variety of rooms. Plus we liked that they had a pool and continental breadfast. We had an upgraded queen room which was bright and the bathroom was roomy too. Overall, the room was average. The bed was shaky and the matress seemed quite old and worn. The pool was small but nice. The continental breakfast was limited but okay. The staff, upon checking in and out, were indifferent and unfriendly. We were pleased with the location off of Truman but close to Duval. We could easily walk to the beach at the Duval Beach Club, the Southernmost Point, and still have an nice walk down Duval to Mallory Square. Parking spots were tiny but managable. When I go back to Key West, I would likely try another hotel given this was was just average for the higher price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent the night here in a cabin by the parking lot with a "private patio" (6x6 ft next to path to some rooms). The room was adequate. A 17" flat screen TV is neat but not for watching from bed. No place to hang up towels by sink. Breakfast OK but does not start till 8:30. Central location a plus. Easy walk to all points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Large clean room”
Reviews.Author: bigdogone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Key Lime Inn January 2nd through January 4th and wished we could have stayed longer. Alex and his staff were very pleasant to deal with and were very helpful. We had a room that opened to the deck and the pool area and would ask for this room again when we return next year. I have problems walking but still managed to walk to most downtown areas.. We loved this quiet place with great parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Key West Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Hokie1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Key Lime Inn 12/28-1/1. We were traveling with 2 other couples who also stayed at the inn. The location is good. Easy to find and within walking distance to a public beach and Duval Street. The walk to Mallory Square is a bit long but it can be entertaining if you take your time and take in the sites of Duval along the way. We chose to walk much of the time but also found the cab ride down to Mallory Square quick and cost only $2.50/person. The rooms are good. We stayed in a King Deluxe which was actually it's own little cottage by the pool. Our room backed up to Truman which is a very busy street but noise typically does not bother us so it was not a problem. If you are bothered by noise, you will want to request a room away from the street. The property is quite large and I'm sure they can accommodate you. My only complaint about the room was the carpet. It looked quite old and due to the humidity in FL, felt damp to bare feet. I felt I had to wear flip flops while in the room. Other than that, the room was fairly clean and comfortable. The pool area is fantastic. If you've never traveled to Key West, you should know it is not known for it's natural beaches. Everything is manmade so unless you want to hoof it to the beach, you will want a hotel with a nice pool area. A lot of the inns in Key West have small properties and often the pool area is small and shaded. Key Lime Inn has a large area with comfortable lounge chairs. We never made it up for breakfast but our friends said it was sufficient. Nothing fancy but fresh. Other recommendations - if you are looking for a nice dinner, you must eat at Hot Tin Roof. Wonderful food and the views are terrific. Fogarty's on Duval has great sandwiches. Skip Willie T's for dinner - only average food and service was terrible. Great mojito's though. We also took a sunset sail with Danger Cruises. It was fantastic and not your typical "booze cruise". This was their Wind & Wine sail which was on a 60' schooner. They limit it to about 25 people and serve nice wine, beer and light appetizers (veggies, cheese, fruit). The crew was terrific and the sunset was just beautiful. I would highly recommend it! If you like to laugh and to sing along to good 80's music, go to Irish Kevins. Always a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 12/4-12/9 2005. Rooms are cottage like in the area around the pool and there are a few cottages lined near the parking lot alongside a big bahamian style house which must have 10 rooms or so. We stayed in a deluxe queen which had a fridge that kept lunch meat and beer cold. bed was nice but pillows sucked unless you like the extremly soft feather pillows. Air worked everything was nice. Pool area was clean had some lounge chairs and tables, no music though. Breakfast was good, they had a toaster for the bagels and muffins, cold OJ. You're about a mile or so to the end of duval and mallory square, which is where sloppy joes, mel fishers museum and the sunsets are. On the opposite side of the island is where the southermost point, house, and hotel are. I would say it's about a 1/2 mile or from the KLI. After walking for a day we decided that the only way we would get to see the whole island was by bike. So we decided to rent them at a charge of $8 day (They give you locks). We literally rode every block in old town key west it was a wise investment. At night going to the duval strip of bars was about a 3/4 mile ride. we would park our blikes about halfway or so and walk from there. don't be afraid to walk your bike home or leave it locked up and walk back in the morning to get it. We chose to just rid them it was safe. Other than that the staff was friendly enough and we had no problems. We never heard roosters in the morning like other reviews we had read. Would go back but after riding the bikes and seeing all the different styles of houses I would probably go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Inn just off of Duval”
Reviews.Author: pbwhite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Key Lime Inn on Dec. 10-11, 2005. We got 'upgraded' to the Deluxe King room from the Superior that we had booked, as it was Fantasy Fest weekend, and they were out of the rooms we had booked (we changed reservations due to hurricaine Wilma). The King room was nice, we were upstairs in the Mallory Building, which had 14 foot ceilings and a nice porch overlooking Truman Ave. The Key Lime has a continental breakfast (pastries, muffins, bagels, coffee & juice) at 8:30 each morning.
