Nice poolside location for breakfast, though likely a bit noisy for the people staying poolside. The KLI doesn't have enough on site parking if they are booked solid, so we parked the first night on the street right nearby. My wife and I loved the location of the KLI - about 400 yards from Duval Street - a full Mile to Mallory Square, but we walked there several times each day. Very nice to have walking access to all of the action on Duval, but not have the noise/action right at the hotel. The rooms include a safe, smallish LCD TV on the wall, and a private bath. I found the receptionist to be very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay at the KLI again if we return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tedgh
Reviews.Content: This small inn was located two blocks from Duval Street. We parked our car on check-in and did not move it again until we checked out. Shops, restaurants, bars, watersports -- Everything within walking distance. We were hesitant to select this property because of its old exterior appearance, but later found that all buildings within Old Town Key West must retain their historic appearance regardless of the use. When we got to the inn, we found it to be quaint and inviting. We chose the superior queen room and was very pleased with the size and the decor. It was bright and cheerful with a cathedral ceiling. The room was very clean and everything appeared new (or at least very well maintained). The grounds were very comfortable. Continental breakfast was served by the pool each morning. We highly recommend the Key Lime Inn and will stay there again when we return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect fit for us”
Reviews.Author: anchormanage
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Key Lime Inn Nov 16-21, 2005 during the Super power boat races. It was great! It was our first time in Key West and we went with about 8 other people staying elsewhere. For the price and location it was a great deal, especially during a major event. I read these reviews before we booked and after having stayed there during a very busy time, I can honestly say that we did not experience the negative things people have said on this site. I would, however, recommend that unless you like to be right next to the pool and are an early morning riser, do not book a room at the poolside area. I emailed in advance my request and it was granted. We had a King size bed, mini-fridge, cathedral ceiling with a fan, a nice bathroom and a private patio sitting area that was fenced in. It was #8 on the right hand side. Perfect spot in my opinion. There was slight water damage to one wall from the hurricane, but I'm sure it was being fixed. Everything was very clean and the continental breakfast is just that - coffee, juice, muffins, etc. If you want a big breakfast there is a Denny's within walking distance, we never felt the need and there was coffee in the room as well. Only problem we experienced was one night we came back to the room and realized we were out of non-alcoholic beverages and when we tried to use the vending machine, it was sold out. From what we found out, it was, of course, the only time the machine ran out. I asked another guest if I could purchase some water or gatorade from them, but they were kind enough to just hand some over to me no problem. This was good because the closest store is a bit of a walk and after the frozen drinks at the Flying Monkey, etc. I did not want to drive the moped alone! We had a double moped from Moped Hospital just up the street and they were great! We had one problem (that I think we caused) and they arrived literally within minutes with an even nicer replacement. When booking a hotel in Key West, you have to know what kind of time you want? Do you want to pay more and be on a beach with a view, and a restaurant, down in a certain area for walking distance, in the middle of the party at Duval, or do you enjoy all that but when the night is done just want to be able to get some good rest in a nice place a very short moped drive away from it all? We were away from the room the majority of the day, would come back, shower up, etc. then go back out. If that's what you are looking for, I would highly recommend the Key Lime Inn. If you want waterfront location and higher rates, the Pier House and Marina area is for you. The staff at the Key Lime was friendly, but not nosey, we parked the moped right under a tree, they let us leave our luggage in the lobby area since we had a late afternoon flight, they called a cab for us, recommended attractions, etc. It was wonderfully fun!

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kendon3153
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Key Lime Inn Nov. 11th through the 14th of 2005. It was our first time to Key West. After checking in and being assigned room #35 a rather rude desk person followed me out to the parking lot and insisted that I re-park my vehicle between two other vehicles which left very little room to open my door to get out. Our room was located close to the swimming pool deck which is made out of wood and resonates any movement on the deck to rooms close to it. Plastic pool furniture is moved back and forth day and night and together with loud guest conversation makes for continuous noise. Sleep day or night is hard to come by. A spartan Continental breakfast at poolside starts around 8:30AM so forget sleeping in as early risers are chatting away and sliding chairs and loungers around the deck. The on hand staff was not very personable, no smiles or friendly conversation. We liked Duval Street which is about a fifteen to thirty minute walk depending on which bar or restaurant you go to. We'll go back to Key West but not to the Key Lime Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATLBritChick
Reviews.Content: Lovely place, just 2 blocks from all the action on Duval. We stayed in Room 14, which was near the back - like a little cottage, really clean and very quiet (except for the roosters, of course!) Breakfasts were pretty good (for continental-style), but for a really good breakfast you can't beat The Deli restaurant which is only about 50 yards from the hotel - great food! We'd definitely stay there again, no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel & close proximity to action”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel75
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Key Lime Inn. I made our reservations online and got a confirmation email from Alex. When we arrived, our room wasn't quite ready since we were a bit early. Alex was able to put us in another room right away. We walked down to Mallory Square to watch the sunset one evening. It was a nice walk and we weren't afraid to walk back to the hotel at night. Before we checked out, we enjoyed the continental breakfast. It was wonderful. The danishes and muffins were fresh. I would definitely stay at the Key Lime Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and didn't actually make it to Key West because of Tropical Storm Katrina. I called the Inn on the morning itself of my reservation to inform them that I would have to cancel my reservation. Because they had a 7-day cancellation policy, I was prepared to pay the full-price; but I asked if I could get a refund anyway because of the weather and the guy on the phone was most nice. There wasn't an evacuation notice and he was in no way obliged to give me a refund, but he did anyway. I thought that was extremely considerate. The next time we plan a trip to the Keys (hopefully not during hurricane season!), we'll be sure to book a room with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Teri64_11
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. I never wanted to stay in a B&B, but found this place to be a little different thatn the average B&B. We stayed in a room that had a fridge and it was located a short walk from the pool. The breakfasts were fine but served as a continental breakfast (toast, bagels muffins, etc) We are not big breakfast eaters, so this was fine. The room was very cute, painted in a light yellow with hard wood floors, a small bathroom with shower stall. We really didn't need the fridge, since we purchased a cooler and used that most of the time. The fridge really didn't keep drinks cold anyway. We used the pool many times and it was never really crowded considering it was on th smaller side. Then again that week they had vacant rooms available. The Inn offers complimentary newspapers every morning and pool towels. It is walking distance into Old town but it is a long walk. We went when it is extremely hot, so try and do your walking early or later in the day. They have great restaurants in the area and really enjoyed our stay. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - I really enjoyed my stay at the Key Lime”
Reviews.Author: pb77
Reviews.Content: Dont let the 5 rating fool you into thinking this is a 5 star hotel - it's not. But for the money and value I rated it a 5. Key Lime was simply perfect. Two blocks off Duval, quiet, cozy, just a great experience. I enjoyed spending my money on things to do instead of on a room I was hardly in. But while at the Key Lime, I have zero complaints. The pool is nice, the grounds were beautiful, the staff was very friendly, the parking was free and available, the rooms were clean and nicely decorated, the balcony was perfect. I actually requested a poolside room but at check-in was told that they didnt have any available so they put me in the main house second floor. After seeing the room, i was glad. It was big, away from the poolside chatter, and it had a better view of the tropical grounds. In fact, if I return to key west i will probably stay at the key lime again and request the same room, room #9. Listen, if you have never been to key west and you dont understand the layout of the old town, trust me, the key lime is perfect. You are a 10 minute walk from mallory square and a 7 minute walk from the southernmost point. Literally right in the middle of everything but secluded enough to get away from the noise and enjoy some tropical peace and quiet. No u dont have a roomside view of the sunset, but why would you want to watch that from your room? Stay at the key lime, save your money, and watch the sunset with everyone else at mallory square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and lovely quaint accommodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Key Lime Inn and were really pleased with the standard of accommodation. The chalet-type room we had was lovely, very clean and well-looked after. The surrounding areas were also really nice and quaint. It was also only a short walk to Duval Street (where all the action is) and was easily accessible to most areas of interest if you like walking. Key West itself is great, lovely architecture, excellent restaurants and fun bars. We had a wonderful time and would certainly recommend both Key West and the Key Lime Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay with the Key Lime Inn. It is a nice, neat and quiet little inn that gives you a wonderful feel of the island life. It is in good walking distance to anything you want to see. The staff is helpful and friendly. I must say if you like and want the feel of a "luxury hotel" you aren't going to find it here. And that is one reason I like this place so well...quiet and layed back like Key West.

Reviews.Title: “LOved this place”
Reviews.Author: TatianaI
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Key Lime in May 2005. I like this place, very quiet location, big parking lot and some free parking spots across the street, where I parked my car after check out time. Pool was clean and well maintained. Our room had a small but modern flat screen TV, which we enjoyed to watch. Room was small, but nice decorated and clean. Breakfast was more bagel style, but outdoor sitting was nice. So I think it's a good place for the money in Key West

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and quiet-liked a.m. coffee and paper”
Reviews.Author: toothgirl
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Key West, but our first time at Key Lime. We really enjoyed our stay! The staff was friendly and helpful. Told us about a great place for burgers:Island Burger, just up the street from Key Lime.We were in cottage #36, by the pool. Great room. A little larger, since this is a handicap room. We enjoyed the morning breakfast and paper. I agree with other folks that the breakfast could be a little more varied. Maybe cold cereal, more fruit. But, we liked the muffins ,especially the blueberry muffins. We rented bikes and used them the entire stay. We went to Fort Zachery State Park, good beach. We also enjoyed the hammock at Key Lime and the swing. We really enjoy Key West and hope to return. We would stay at Key Lime again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Bungalow Style”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth staying if the rates are working in your favor compared to other hotels. Great location, but cheap construction bungalow style lodging. Window treatments did not fully cover windows and all rooms are at street level BUT the pool and chickens and atmosphere were great. Room was a bit smallish but clean, flat screen tv in room with complete cable. A little bit of everyone staying here the same time I did- retirees, families with children (old and young) and young professional couples. Very Very Kind and Helpful staff. I will probably adventure elsewhere for lodging but again, I do not regret staying there for the price I found it, again, I say Great Location.

HotelInfo.Name: Key Lime Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 725 Truman Ave, Key West, FL 33040
